reviewText:
If I were to write a review a few weeks ago, I'd give it a solid 9/10 and recommend this game to everyone.

It's an amazing game with beautiful graphics that runs pretty smooth even on my old PC. The city is well crafted with amazing little details on every corner, and main missions in general are pretty fun. Side activities are typical Ubisoft game though, kinda repetitive. Gunplay is so satisfying with great cover mechanics. Enemies (factions) are varied enough with their own characteristics. I can go either solo, play with friends or go with randoms via matchmaking to do everything in this game. The leveling experience in The Division is one of the best I've ever had in an mmo(lite). I'd give the 1-30 journey a solid 9/10.

And then I stumbled upon the endgame. The real meat of the game where I'm supposed to spend most of my time there.  CM are really a challenge, however they're kinda limited in number. It was originally okay before the incursion patch hit, but everything has changed since then. It's way harder to get crafting materials post patch, which means you need to grind your ♥♥♥ to craft your weapon/gear. Incursion is a mess, people can exploit it to beat it way easier. Massive then remove weekly rewards so people who're not exploiting are basically screwed. You may choose to not use the exploits, but you'll be left behind others, and you definitely won't stand a chance in the Dark Zone where everyone is an exploiter. If you're a competitive player, you'll have to use the exploits. The first free update is the turning point of the game for me.

The game is a mess from its core. There are too many fundamental problems while maybe can be fixed, but will need a lot of work and testing. Massive can only find the exploits after the players abusing them. And when they do fix one, players find another two exploits. Every day there's new glitches and exploits, but they can only apply a patch once a week or two. And it's been going on since day 1. They just can't keep up with the pace of people finding new glitches. And you can't blame them for finding those exploits, the game isn't supposed to have ridiculous amount of them. It's been a month and this game feels like a beta for me. The Division is probably the most squandered potential of a game in years.

Massive needs a 'timeout' to totally fix their game, but sadly they don't have it. The show must go on..

reviewText:
The worst game ever.

Don't get me wrong.  I love this game so much.  I pre-order the Gold Edition on Steam with full price.  And I've played for almost 700 hrs.  I tried and played almost every aspect of the game.  And I also constantly browsing and discussing on Division subreddit.  Frankly speaking, this is really a nice game but the devs sucks.

+ Really nice graphic.  Although SnowDrop is a new game engine, the graphic still looks awesome.
+ Cover system is good for 3rd-person shooter.
+ Neat and clean UI design.  Informative but minimal design.

- Connection problem as always.  UBI servers are really bad that even worse in MMO.
- Cheaters and hackers everywhere.  No matter you're playing in PVP or PVE, there are TONS of cheaters makes the game totally unplayable.
- Looting and crafting system are jokes.  You may get nothing worthy for about 4 hours play since the loot drop is awful and the crafting requirements are unreasonable in some way.
- The end-game is tedious.  Maybe it's just because this is a new game, the lacking of end-game content makes you get bored very soon.
- The new gamemode, Incursion, design is quite bad.  Very small map with 15 waves of overlevel enemies only.
- The PVP is totally unplayable due to cheating.  And the elite enemies distribution is unbalanced and the rewards are not scale up with the difficulty.  Everyone level up in DZ03, and nobody go to DZ06 since the rewards are almost the same as DZ01.
- Currently there is no cheat detection system implemented.  They try to find cheaters manually and it's inefficiency and inaccurate.
- The ban is also a joke.  Only 3-day ban for hacking before, and now it's only 14-day ban.  Cheaters still cheating.
- Lots of game breaking glitches and bugs.

Ubisoft ruined almost everything.  And the support is really slow and unhelpful.  I submitted a ticket to UBI support on 20th April, and got response on 6th May with unhelpful answer.  Moreover, lots of problems/suggestions on Reddit were discussed.  Redditors pinpoint the issues and even provide possible solutions.  But devs never listen.  Lots of game breaking issues are not fixed.

Actually I quit this game on 20th April, 2016.  After a month later, there's still no improvement in Division.  So I totally cannot recommend this game although I want to.

Good game, bad devs.

--

史上最差的遊戲。

別誤會，我很喜歡這款遊戲，我在Steam預購了黃金版，而遊戲時數接近七百小時，我嘗試並接觸過遊戲所有部分，同時我也常常在Reddit上參與討論。坦白講，這是一款好遊戲，但是爛開發商。

+ 十分優異的畫面表現，雖然SnowDrop是個新引擎，但是整體畫面看起來很棒。
+ 掩體系統在第三人稱射擊很方便上手。
+ 簡潔乾淨的介面設計，適時的提供必要資訊卻又不會雜亂。

- 連線一樣老問題，UBI的伺服器實在是很差，尤其在這種強調多人連線的遊戲內更嚴重。
- 各種外掛作弊滿街跑，不論你玩PVP還是PVE，到處都是外掛跟作弊，讓整個遊戲幾乎無法正常進行。
- 掉落跟製作系統是個笑話，常常會打了四小時結果拿到的都是無用的垃圾，而製作材料需求設計又非常的誇張不合理。
- 貧乏的封頂內容，或許因為這是個新遊戲，但貧乏的內容讓你滿等後很快就會感到無聊。
- 新模式，襲擊，設計的頗差，只是一個非常小的地圖搭配15波超強的越等敵人而已。
- 到處都是外掛，PVP幾乎無法玩，而PVP的菁英敵人部屬非常不平衡，且獎勵也沒有隨難度提高，所有人都擠在暗區03升級，然後根本沒有人要去暗區06，因為獎勵跟暗區01差不多爛。
- 目前為止遊戲內完全沒有作弊偵測的系統，他們嘗試用人工的方式找作弊玩家，但非常沒效率而且不準確。
- 停權機制也是個笑話，之前抓到作弊只停權三天，現在提高了也只是十四天而已，作弊的仍然繼續作弊。
- 還有一堆讓遊戲完全無法正常運行的漏洞和bug。

Ubisoft幾乎毀掉了所有東西，而且官方客服效率極差，我4/20的時候提交了一個問題給官方客服，到5/6才收到回覆，而且回覆內容官腔又沒幫助。此外，在Reddit上很多人討論了許多潛在問題，並提出了可能的修改方式與建議，但官方幾乎都沒有採用，許多誇張的bug仍然沒有修正。

事實上，我在2016年4月20日就沒有再開過這款遊戲，現在過了一個月，看起來仍然沒有改進，因此雖然我很喜歡，但我仍然無法推薦這款。

好遊戲，爛公司。

reviewText:
When it has all been said and done, I think most reviews and the criticisms of the The Division are warranted.

To sum it up in a nutshell, The Division is to gaming history, the most wasted potential videogame of all-time.  It has an excellent premise, but it is poorly executed in not only gameplay, but story, environmental and level design, and NPC interactions, or lack thereof.

The lack of an anti-cheat system leaves you wondering what Massive Entertainment and Ubisoft were thinking during the planning, strategy, and conceptualization stages of development.  Not only do hackers or players without a conscience continue to exploit this game, Massive has denounced a statement saying that an anti-cheat system is basically out of the question because we would need to build this game from the ground up again."

Unlike some other The Division early adopters
date: I was never butt-hurt by the E3 gameplay
recommended: or the mad and sickening hype.  Unfortunately for me

voteText: even as pre-apocalyptic or apocalyptic world.  Ubisoft and Massive should have opted for a ficticious city instead of a realistic New York.  Trading a videogame fantasy world for a more realistic one is one of the major drawbacks to The Division's level and environmental design.  The problem with this is

column25: fun gameplay and loot. The Division features loot as guns and "gear
column26:
which in some sense it does well.  The character design is pretty to look at and the clothing, equipment, and armor all look great aethestically but nothing more.

The Division relies heavily on crafting and farming Pheonix credits which you would then trade in to a vendor to purchase new weapons, equipment, or blueprints.  At the moment, players have to rely too heavily on crafting gear in order to take on the only incursion we have in the game.  Daily assignments are few and far in between, so you would have to complete the daily assignments for Pheonix credits every day in order to rack up hundreds of credits to purchase the gun or blueprint that you need to pack any kind of punch for an incursion.  *Massive did state with a recent update that they are attempting to remedy this issue.  We will see about that.

MMOs have instances or dungeons and this is typically the meat of the endgame where players farm for loot or gear.  Ubisoft/Massive gave" us an Incursion called "The Falcon: Lost" as a free update.  This is the problem and plague of the current situation of the videogame industry.  "FREE UPDATES" and what is it

The new Patch opended my eyes to how pointless it all is, they made it even harder to get new gear and the grind longer.  I now feel depressed and angry that i wasted 130+ hours of my life on this ♥♥♥♥ good god ill never get thoes precious seconds back.

reviewText:
EDIT Between the ~~~

Original Post:

After looking at some of the reviews on here I feel like 90% of them are complete bull.

1) Server crashed... okay, good for you but I started playing this as soon as I got off work until just now and had litterally zero issues with the server. The fact that they fixed their server problem in less than a day is fine by me. I've seen many games launch and not be playable for a week (diablo 3?)

2) Uplay sucks... how? I clicked the copy code to clipboard button when steam prompted me to, uplay asked for code, i pressed ctrl+v and hit enter, division launched and played just fine. I have not had to open Uplay once in order to play this game so how this is a problem I don't know.

3) Graphics suck... ummm get a better card? I have a GTX970 and am playing 55+ fps on average with dips down to about 40 with a lot going on outside at 1440p. BTW the game looks amazing in 1440p.

4) Grinding for gear... well yeah genius, if you couldn't figure out from the OPEN beta and countless of youtube videos and news articles that this was similar to destiny or diablo in its kill badguy to get better loot to kill harder badguy game then you're an idiot. Don't buy a genre you dont like.

5) AI is bad... It's an RPG style cover based shooter where the AI uses the cover. yes they will pop their head out to shoot at you after a few seconds. Oddly enough this is exactly what you are doing after you reload, does this make you a bad player? Does the AI act like a real human in any other RPG you've played?

Now that that is out of the way, this game has been out less than a day. I can't say if this is something I am going to play for months or not, but I have enjoyed it so far and have had no reason to give it a bad review. If I decide the game actually is bad in a week or so I will revisit this and add an edit to the end. If this is the last line you see then I still feel like its a good game and not anywhere near as bad as people are making it out to be.

~~~
I did not realize everyone on steam was going to read/comment on this. I will edit this review with actual opinion about the game once I have completed the main story and put some more time into it.

Finished the main story and got BoO to 100% in just over 38 hours played. (happened almost at the same time do to my completionist play style)

So far the only negatives I have are that microphone is defaulted to voice sensetivity rather than PTT which is annoying but I can mute people. Dark zone feels lackluster, roaming mobs and stationairy groups at the landmarks. other than that there isnt much to do in the DZ unless you go rogue and kill other players. The side missions and encounters were almost all carbon copies of one another which I suppose could get boring. realiztically there are a limited number of them total so its only repetative for a little while. I enjoyed the story. The amount of content included is more than enough to get you to max level. I hit level 30 after completing the final mission and I have only a few side missions and encouters to do. I wont go too much into gameplay because if you are reading this, chances are you have seen some gameplay on youtube and my typing is not going to describe it nearly as well as a video can. I'm looking forward to gearing up for what is to come and playing new content as it comes out.

Maybe I will update this as more content is realeased. If you are reading this I decided not to since youtube will pretty much have you covered.
~~~

reviewText:
Warning: slight spoiler alert

The game has wonderful stories, wonderful art design, and a big title of Tom Clancy.

But it is not a good game at all. It is full of deception.

In the first 20 hours, you survive alone in ruin NYC, everything seems to be new, attracting and challenging.

And then you get to lvl 30.

You enter the DZ, get killed by all kinds of cheaters and hostile players. It sucks.

You try to clear Daily Missions, have equipment with better GS, spends hours on a stupid Challenge Mission. It is stupid, because the golden gear of lvl 182 is nothing comparing to the new gear set in the new mission, which is too hard that those who made it can't pass it in one try. And it will soon get out-of-time in no time.

And Ubisoft have run the game perfectly against the normal player, fixing every bug that make players grow quickly in a rush while leaving those cheaters as the king of the world. Not to mention the spam message in the public channel and the awful potato servers with frequent disconnect, lag and error.

The biggest sadness is that when you realize all of this, you have passed the refund time.
That's why I call it deception.

General Score:

0/10 Not recommend

+4 Great Story

+4 Great TPS experience

-8 Ubisoft running, no anti-cheating mechanism, terrible servers with force Internet links

PS: I won't purchase any Ubisoft game again. (I would use pirate copies if the game were really attracting.)

Update 27/4/2016:

Recently I saw Ubisoft's efforts against cheating by moving some of the mechanism from local clients to the servers, such as reload clip. In a way it makes the game more realistic": your weapons may stuck time to time and you can't reload or shoot for a few second. In fact it is only caused by lag. I save those complaints and let you friends imagine what will happened if your weapon failed in a war zone.

I have heard that the designers put some parts of calculating on local clients to relieve the bundle of servers

Let us see if the newest gourmet from France are fried potato chips.\n\nUpdate 15/05/2016: Have you ever eaten any ****? This game will be the precious experience for you. The most desperate thing is that you can't shoot

reviewText:
Ok, SO i have played this game for a crazy amount of time. and i will say the game is really great, although the game is boring at the begining / middle area of the game and the boss are very repetitive the last few missions of the game show extreme potential and are extreme fun and challenging. I have completed the game and pretty much tested everything. so i guess i can atempt to list some of the things i found awesome and some not.

Awesome Stuff
1. Challenging Difficulty is freaking insane, it isnt just a small step above hard its a very large jump, it gives you a challenge and there is no way in hell you are just picking this up at fresh 30 and just farming your ♥♥♥ some Superior items unless you're the dankest memer the world has ever seen.

2. Final mission, Without spoiling to much its very difficult ( if you do it on hard solo ) and shows extreme potential for raid content and variety in the game instead of just shooting bosses or hitting T and just holding yourr left click.

3. Darkzone, The darkzone is crazy cool and the concept is rich with potential,  only complaint is it kinda encourages you to just stealthly betray people rather than full on pvp. But the PVE aspects are great and the rush from getting your first High grade item and trying to evac it is just great.

4. The content seems to be planned on a consistent basis. we can hope that they stick to it but for now they have already planned out the first 3 expacs for this game, only downside is you gotta pay for them or the season pass.

Bad things in the game?

1. It is really hard for players that do the game solo, its very doable but if you're not good at shooters its not going to be that easy, they do have the matchmaking system but lets be honest past the first few first months of this game the lower levels wont be able to do much match making.

2.  Until about level 25 the game is a cake walk, and the content is pretty repetitive, at the start you are immersed and loving them game and then you get to id say about level 10 and its just boring for the next 15 levels. ( luckily its fast leveling )

3. pvp exists but its not instance based or really encouraged. having something like a battleground or arena or something of this nature would help the pvp driven players find that thing that is missing, darkzone pvp is stale and boring and no body wants to lose xp or coins right now so yeah.

4. Its 60$ plus another like 30$ for the season pass. In this day in age your game better have some craaaazy content to be 60$, For instance not even WoW does 60$ expansions anymore, its  just not a good idea. Especially with the content in game right now i dont think this game is 60$ value, in june or so, maybe, Because then we get a new expansion.

OK The last thing i would like to bring to late is the idiots saying this game is repetitive and server crash issues are stupid etc etc. Its repetitive because its an MMO with shooter aspects, not the other way around. If you look at every single MMO out there, it is repetitive, even the sandbox mmos have repetition. Server crash issues should be expected the first day a game is out, its server flooding and the beta as good as it was doesnt really give you a 100% sure idea when a game comes out, most games experience lag and dcs day one or in first few hours. Now that the game is a few days old servers are fine and gameplay is really smooth. Hope this review helps and good luck!

Shameless Plug https://www.twitch.tv/tagord96 ( if you wanna watch some Footage )

reviewText:
I'm pretty torn when it comes to this game.

What is positiv:
- Game handling is good.
- The graphics are very well made
- Game details like the map design are well picked.
- The story is very realistic

What is negative:
- The gameplay is unbelievable repetitive like kill a bunch of npc's and hit the button
- Weapons aren't well balanced
- PVP is almost impossible for sincere players, due to the fact that there are way too many players around using cheat programs.
- the missions difficulty level is laughable. After about 50 hours play time you're able to complete missions on thge challenging level on your own.
- the cost-benefit ratio is terrible. At least for me. I payed EUR 89.00 for the game (including a season pass) affective  play time was 195h wich is EUR 0.45/h.

After several encounters with hackers in the PVP zone (Dark-Zone) the game started to frustrate me. So I stopped playing. If you don't know which kind of hacks I've already experienced and seem to be common, here is a list:
- aim bot
- wall hack
- teleport
- speed hack
- no clip
- flying around

For me the negative points outweigh the positive ones.
Therefor my rating for the game is negative right now.

If Ubisoft can fix the hacking problem I might rejoin the game. If not, I won't.

reviewText:
It took me a long time, several days of play time, to come to this conclusion.

The Division is, in no way, a *bad* game. It is, however, aggressively mediocre. It is forgettable, deeply flawed, and a huge missed opportunity.

The first thing I want to get to is the Dark Zone -- it is, in both practice and concept, a horrible experience. The best gear in the game, ostensibly the goal for most people playing an RPG, is gated behind an experience that relishes having other players steal your hard-earned loot. I literally would have zero problem with this IF there were a way to get that kind of gear elsewhere in PvE, but there is not. The stance of the developers and some fans of well nut up and play the game or go away" on this is simply insulting. Why they would put this DayZ/Rust-style anarchy as the center of endgame is beyond me.

The next big issue: enemy variety. There IS none. I have now played almost 18 hours of this game

reviewText: The Division was a really fun game as I progressed through Manhattan, but after reaching the end game there wasn't anything to do other than go into the dark zone to pvp, or do the daily missions. The April update brought incursions and more daily and weekly assignments which made a better end game, but the end game still feels bland and repetitive. While the paid expansions coming later in the year might fix the end game, I can't recommend a game that makes you grind for better look so you can grind easier. The darkzone is filled with hackers who can increase their damage output to take all of your loot, so until Ubisoft fixes the hacker issue, you are stuck to PvE alone or with a group of up to four. I recommend you wait until Ubisoft releases more endgame activities, or until Ubi releases more end game PvE missions.\n\nVerdict: Wait for a sale, or until Ubi adds more content/fixes the PvP.  I cannot currently recommend this game as it feels like the end game was rushed and unfinished.

reviewText:
Imagine the intensity of this scenario. You and your other 2 friends have just entered the Dark Zone. It is a cold winter night and there is a high amount of snowfall. Visibility is reduced to only a couple of feet in front of you. As your group trudges along the garbage and body filled streets in the center of the epidemic, you hear a faint noise. It starts to sound like the sound of muffled gunshots. Curiosity got the best of us and we began to search out this noise. After a few minutes of trying to navigate the blizzard and small alley ways we finally made it to the point of origin of the said noises. Dead silence... We walk into the middle of what seemed to be an extraction zone when we realized we had just sprung a group of Rogue agents trap.

Gunshots ring out. Blind cover fire goes out. We are in the middle of a large open area like sitting ducks. We start to panic and got the adrenaline pumping sensation as we frantically try to seek cover. With little to no cover available we are quickly picked off by the well positioned and well equipped Rogues we have heard so much about.

We sadly accepted our defeat and returned to the nearest Dark Zone checkpoint. At this point, it felt as if the blizzard would never end, as we continued to push our way through the dark zone. We sought out a small contaminated zone, located inside an underground parking garage. As we approached, what a sight we saw. The 3 dirty Rogue agents that killed us were sitting at a loot crate we had wanted. It seemed like they were checking the stats on the new items they had acquired giving us an opportunity.

Are we going to do this?"

"Heck yes."

We lined up our shots and promptly dropped what seemed as the groups pointman. A ring went out announcing the betrayal of our group
date: declaring us as Rogue agents. After finishing off the final 2 members of the enemy group we realized what this meant. Everyone. Would. Be. After. Us.\n\nWithin minutes several others were chasing after us. We held out as long as possible in the parking garage. Our squad was working like clockwork

We pushed our way through the streets dropping enemy npc's as they came along and the occassional flanking agent who thought he was so clever to try to flank us alone. We reached the subway and rushed in. At this point we were full fledged rogues

Bullets whizzed by and the sound carried through the long hallways of the subway. Grenades were tossed back and forth as the shrapnel tore up both sides. As the other agents gained ground

reviewText:
Most people thought this game was going to suck. Honestly, it did in some ways, however, i peaked my interest enough for me to play for 110 hours. Let me explain why I would recommend this game and why I would not.

First off, I will talk about why i would recommend it.

The story mode is awesome, i had fun and enjoyed it.

If you are a grind-a-holic, this is the game for you and i would fully recommend it. You can grind your heart out in challenge missions after level 30 and then use the phoenix credits to buy great new gear to go back and DO THE SAME THING. So basically, that's it for level 30. Ok, well there is also the dark zone actually that is pretty much the same thing. You find a group and you kill.. for hours and hours to reach dark zone 50. and then what? you get gear with dark zone currency or phoenix credits.

Let me explain another reason to why this game is great for people who love to grind. You can also craft the same gear over and over and over again until you get something you actually want or is useful. However, you will spend a lot of time getting mats and of course, doing challenge missions or dark zone for hours to get them.

You see i AM a grind-a-holic and thats why i played for so long to see if the fruits of my playing would turn out but this is uninteresting to me. There is not much controls or content to even stay connected and the abilities and skills limit to only a few useful ones. Talents are kind of ehhhhh but i feel a lack of skills.

This game is not recommended for the most part because IT IS a grindfest. IF you do not like to grind, DO NOT BUY IT. Be prepared for countless hours doing challenge missions or dark zone getting the same gear and currency over and over      hoping you will get something good.

I had fun but its not for me. If this review helped out, wonderful! If not, i apologize and contact me at Aciteoz@gmail.com  for further info about this game.

reviewText:
I'll go as far to say this is the biggest disappointment since BRINK. So much potential, and a great foundation, but it's another AAA title released with little-to-no content, and you will likely have to spend over $100 to get a decent experience with future DLC. Not only that, but there are so many stupid bugs that are still in the game that SHOULDN'T be after an alpha and two betas.

There are also cheaters around like mad in the Dark Zone.

A beautiful world... but it's so barren. There's almost no reason to free roam the map, as there are no real random events on the map. I just can't help but feel disappointed with what could have been.

As of now, stay away and avoid like the plague. I usually don't preorder games, for this reason, but they somehow convinced me to get hyped for this game after the beta. My mistake.

reviewText:
I wanted to love this game, I really did. Ever since its announcement I have been following it as close as possible, pleading the developers to bring it to the PC. The idea of an MMO, modern shooter in New York City is a wonderful idea and early gameplay (and later gameplay as well) looked great.

Now that I actually have the game... well I've come to the harsh reality that the book isn't half as good as the cover art. The Division isn't a horrible game, but it isn't the first class, open world MMORPG Shooter it sold itself as. I'll simply end up forgetting it. Let's look over the Pros and Cons

PROS:
-The world itself is wonderfully constructed. While the graphics are meh, the actual construction of the city is great, and it does feel like Manhattan turned upside down. Trash is everywhere, cars careened in the sides, and hordes of hungry, desperate people try to stay alive. One minute you are participating in a pitched firefight at Madison Garden, the next you are clearing an apartment room by room, looking over the trashed remains of a child's bedroom. That can hit you hard and these moments are the best the Division has to offer.

-The story works... sort of. It's nothing special, the acting is a little stilted, but all in all, it gets you into the world and invested in it. You don’t need much more from it than it provides.

-Teaming up with other players feels good and the tactics of team fighting work rather well. The AI isn't anything special, but it can be difficult enough to give a challenge to your team. A verity of skills and specializations also make different characters work well together, each having a role in your squad.

-Customization of your characters feels good. Outfits all work well and you can give your character a utilitarian, unique look that fits the world. It doesn't fall into the trap of one character wearing authentic armor and another a solid diamond bikini that many games fall into. It all feels serious, ingrained in the world.

CONS:

-Combat is rather basic and even a little mind numbing. Every battle feels the same, no matter what equipment your foes bring to the fight. You use the same two abilities every time, fire the same assault rifle, and rarely use another weapon unless you run out of ammunition. The AI isn't brain dead, but it does nothing interesting, nothing that will ever surprise you. If you die, it’s either because you make a dumb decision, or you picked a fight with something that is simply too much of a bullet sponge to kill.

-The graphics are meh. If you play on a low to mid-tier system, things will look really splotchy, sort of muddy at all points. Higher end systems remedy this, but even then it’s not anything we can't find in any other modern game. The meat of the graphics is in its final product, not the assets or effects used to achieve it.

-The combat mechanics themselves are lackluster, reminding me a lot of Spec Ops, The Line. Guns don't really feel different and against the persistent bullet sponge enemies you face, your loadout feels weak at all times. Even the machine guns, marksman rifles, and magnum revolvers come off as piddle after you fire a few thousand rounds at a single foe wearing a hoodie. They sound good, but the feel and impact are lacking.

-The total game lacks depth. If you are going to do anything, you do it by shooting. Want to save someone? Shoot someone. Gather gear? Shoot someone. Fix tech? Shoot someone. Recruit an ally? Shoot someone. Gather blood samples to counteract a deadly disease? Shoot someone. There is just no variety and the core gameplay is too shallow to make up for this.  You will grow tired of this very quickly.

-I have no issue with looters or grinders and have indeed enjoyed the aspect in a number of games (I even liked Destiny's later implementation of it) but this game just doesn't make it work. All items feel the same, some having higher numbers than others. The few that have special abilities are really just stat increases that trigger every so often. While I love the feeling of opening a container to find the secrets within, the Division just made me go Yay. +1 to my stat. Woooo...." In order to make a good looter
date: the LOOT has to be special or at least exiting. The Division failed at this. Small increases in stats does not a good looter make.\n\n-The MMO aspect feels a bit... sectioned off. It’s as if the entire theory of this section was "Big Fences Make Better Neighbors". In my entire play period I worked with another player all of one time
recommended: and that was because I used the matchmaking (which can take FOREVER
hoursPlayed: even on launch day). You miss that special element of walking down the street and bumping into someone else
voteText: or stumbling upon the remains of another player's pitched firefight. While areas like the Dark Zone do this well enough
helpfulPercent: and Safe Houses allow you to rub noses with other Agents
votesHelpful: the moment you walk out the door
votesTotal: you are alone
votesFunny: and you feel it. An MMO should never
commentsCount: ever

column18:
especially in the heart of New York City.

FINAL THOUGHTS

Ultimately

column20: I feel no need to return to it. I'm not hooked into the story and while the world they built is extraordinary

That's my experience with the Division. I would not recommend it.

reviewText:
The game looks fantastic. It runs well.  And that's about all we can hope for anymore isn't it?

Let me tell you something.  You've already played this game.  Probably a dozen times. I know I have. You've cleared the building before.  You've swapped your gear for more gear.  You've opened the shiny loot container for a bandage that you can't carry.  There is nothing new or innovative about this game.  It's the same old thing in a new shiny package.  It has crafting.  Of course it does.  Everything has to have crafting these days.  Lots of long runs to the next objective.  Cause none of us have played any hiking simulators in the past few years.  Talent system with special powers?  Obviously. Special powers in a  cover-based tactical  3rd person shooter...

The gameplay is extremely easy and I find it deeply unsatisfying.  The overwhelming majority of quests are kill quests of one degree or another that provide little challenge.  The third person view and cover based mechanics directly clash with each other.  It's not a shooter.  It's Zeus hurling lightning bolts. You can see everyone at all times, all their movements, preparing to throw a grenade, when they pop up, when they go down.  You can shoot with astounding accuracy over cover without exposing yourself.  And should an enemy actually be hidden, don't worry, theres a superpower that gives you xray vision.

On the point of upgrading gear, they've found a way to make it even less satisfying than its been in all the other games we've been playing since WoW.  They seperated the gear with stats from the gear that alters appearance.  Ignorning that the majority of the appearance gear" looks largely similar
date: now you have two gear screens that you have to maintain and more nonsense sort.  What that achieved for me is making it so that I completely ignore my characters appearance.  Well done.\n\nPersonally
recommended: I don't think this game deserves the hype or the success it's recieving.  But that's the state of gaming today isn't it?  As much as I dislike this game
hoursPlayed:
it's probably going to be one of the best titles to come out of the next month or two.

With the recommend buttons looming below my ever-growing review I'm forced to concede that if you are as disillusioned as I am about the state of gaming these days then you must admit this game does not deserve your support.  But what else is there?  If you are interested in this game and are willing to knowingly pay more than it is probably worth... then it's ok.  It's ok because we don't have a better benchmark right now.

tl;dr This game is like another Wal-Mart popping up in your home town.  You know it's not good. You'd rather it wasn't there. But Wal-mart has shiny graphics and it runs well on your PC.  So it's not the worst thing in the world to shop there.  But your money is better spent elsewhere.

*edit - some commas and some words"

reviewText:
Prettiest money-grab ever created.

Awful servers, often laggy, and too many problems with disconnects and poor stability.

I am still dumbfounded that this game broke sales records" and still does not have a ♥♥♥♥ing anticheat. That is appalling.

The DZ (PVP ZONE) is littered with cheaters like roaches. I'm glad I didn't buy into their "money-grab pass" either after experiencing how many cheaters there are and how much it ruins the game.

Did I mention that Delta-Senpai does not notice you? Mike-kun doesn't give a ♥♥♥♥ about you.

They say it's like Diablo with guns but it REALLY ISN'T. Blizzard actually gives their gamer's drops unlike this grindfest ♥♥♥♥-game. Their items make sense!!! The ♥♥♥♥ you get in this game makes no sense!!! The talent on my backpack is literally useless! Healing a device that I don't use for a miniscule amount which makes no ♥♥♥♥ing difference because challenging NPCs blow it up with 1 bullet anyways! The worst part is you can't even reroll the talent so your stuck with useless ♥♥♥♥ you can't get rid of because that's how Ubisoft wants it.

Every other patch they ninja-nerf drops or alter something like crafting so now it takes you like 30+ elite materials total to craft 1 item. EST 10 months of playtime to get 1 upgrade because every craft takes like 3 ♥♥♥♥♥ you can only get from the DZ that are on a long ♥♥♥ respawn timer and completely luck based.(Now takes 4 gold dz materials but named gold enemies can drop them WoWowwoWoW)

Ubisoft never actually focuses on the ♥♥♥♥ that matters either. Challenging boss drops 4 gold (elite) items!? WOW WE CAN'T HAVE DAT! People might actually have a chance to get a good piece of gear that way! Nerfed! LATA NERDS!

Meanwhile there are still the same bugs that have been around since day 1 (like stats not showing correctly

reviewText:
All these negative reviews are bashing the game for its repetitiveness and grind without even keeping in the mind the genre. Such games are meant to be like this. Diablo? Destiny? Torchlight? Van Helsing? Path of Exile? They all follow the same formula so if you are whining about the game being grindy, forcing you to kill the same enemy types again and again, the genre is obviously not for you.

Bullet sponge enemies..uhh seriously? Mass Effect? Gears of War? Borderlands? The game is supposed to be a RPG. How exactly will you differentiate between a level 5 enemy and a level 20 if it takes the same time to kill both? And if you have the right gear, enemies aren't bullet sponges at all. I got a marksman rifle that kills enemies of the same level as me with 2 body shots.. Even Battlefield has the same damage mechanic!!

Yes the game had a downtime of about 2hrs on launch day but after that it has all been smooth sailing.

Don't be salty, if you have even just one friend willing to play, buy the game without hesitation

reviewText:
I played the closed and open betas and this game is awesome.
Here you can find my list of pros & cons that can be completely different for you:


PROS:
MMO's elements: Crafting/Perks/Loots/Emotes are actually good.  We are waiting for new concepts like trading goods between players	 has been added.
Progress system is perfect! I can improve my character, get new gears, unlock new talents, and seeing them more powerful.
Stunning graphics and high details level. Still beautiful even if you put it on low to gain some FPS.
Customisable HUD & Elegant interface/map design.
Good optimization for PC and very smooth animations:Originally posted by Ubisoft:it's a native PC version and NOT an adjusted console version for PCI liked the Cover system, it replaces the jump/crouch abilities to add a new movement mechanic  Check out this video for more info
Choose your game style and find your role! For example i like to play as a medic guy with full healing equipment, in order to revive my mates easily and give them a massive healing waves.
Adrenaline: Lots of fun, especially when you become a Rogue (the most wanted enemy) and you have to survive against all other players (good feeling).

CONS:
Simply like any other game, the division has its own cons, because there is no one game with 100% of pros:

Unfair PVP system in the DarkZone
Personalization has few options, especially character's face (i need to modify more things in order to make a unique character).
We need more activities, i mean a new activity more than just shooting enemies (maybe in the next coming DLCs)
Ubisoft network = TRASH...NOT a new info i know. (Update #1: Servers are actually" stable).
The game still expensive just like other Ubi titles.
I think a successful multiplayer game should be more accessible to be played. This may explain why Rainbow Six Siege servers suffer from a lack of players. We go back to say again "Good game
date:
Bad company" every time we remember your prices.
Solution: Make your game more accessible by decreasing its price or support us with Free DLCs content. Or give us the Season Pass for Free to solve this point. I abused here?

Results and Final Word:
I give it 8/10 for (80% Graphics
recommended: 85% gameplay and 75% optimization).\n\ni recommend it because the game has a big potential

reviewText: Fantastic concept and hints of greatness rendered completely worthless by bugs, overpowered teams and more bugs. Played through endgame and lots of darkzone time. Kept giving it a try only to be disspaointed and jaded. Now I'm done with this title...uninstall.\n\nAt least 25% of the time, matchmaking replay missions don't load correctly (starting points blocked) and you have to roll the dice and reload. Additionally, several times I have been in the darkzone and could not call in a helicopter (prompt doesn't even appear) or see the rope because of a bug. When I quit and reload I usually end up halfway across the map in a safe room and get ambused by hit and run teams. On top of that, rogue players are way gone by the time you could try and catch up...little lone trying to take them down. And let's not forget getting stuck in objects on the map, server errors  and players you can't even see on screen running into your firefight or explosions that turn you rogue.

reviewText:
Playing through the game the first time is quite enjoyable, I loved the story and the potential it has.
BUT, the total lack of endgame, loot being total out of whack, devs not having a single clue how to listen to their community and apply proper fixes, their stance (or lack of) of exploiters and the amount of hackers are making it real hard to enjoy this game post-30.
The first incursion is a complete joke, good luck sitting through 20-30 mins of soul-crunching waves of the same enemies over and over in the same room. Devs seem to think scaling dmg and health of enemies is a proper way to increase difficulty, it's NOT.
The dark zone, now here's a joke, to get the best gear, grind your way to rank 75 (100+ hours) to get access to the best weapon blueprints, good luck avoiding all the hackers and exploiters that got a free pass for exploiting the incursion when it released and are decked out in full gearscore 240 gear and are picking on the lower legit playerbase.

The only way this game can redeem itself is if the devs take a good hard look at how Diablo 3 redeemed itself from vanilla to it's current state, go from there. Make the PvE zone actually useful after 30, implement roaming boss packs like there are in the dark zone, don't force people that don't like PvP to go to the dark zone in order to compete for the best gear. This all will most likely not happen, but I can dream.

First thing first. NO it doesn't suck, as many people are saying. It's not good in my eyes either. The Division falls somewhere inbetween for me. Pros -
- Great visuals and effects. Lighting was pretty meh, but the fog and snow effects are rivaled only by skyrim mods.

reviewText:
Oldschool pvp where the only thing that matters is your gear :<
Its like Diablo 1, except Diablo 1 had several playstyles you could do, this is just shoot the bad guys, and diablo at least had a hardcore mode.

Devs use bullet sponge to increase the difficulty, the laziest way to increase the difficulty of a game. Just increase the enemies hp to the point that it takes 3 magazines to kill them, 10 for a boss..

If you don't cheat, it will takes about 150 hours to get geared up, after you've hit max lvl. So if you want a 2nd job, this game might be for you.

Hacking! I've seen noclip godmode hacks, guys literally just flying around instagibbing everything within 100m.

In conclusion, if you like games that trick your mind into a hamster wheel dopamine drip of tiny accomplishments, then this game isn't as good as a clicker game. But if you also want good gfx and that hamster wheel tiny dopamine drip, yes this is for you. However, if your a junky and want extreme rushes of awesomeness that can only be found in competititive pvp games with risk attached, this is not for you.

reviewText: This game is frustrating, poorly balanced and has extraordinarily bad pacing for the story. The game feels very rough, unpolished, and has numerous bugs both large and small that lend to an extreme level of annoyance. I cannot recommend this game at all. I was really looking forward to a new Tom Clancy game, but I was highly disappointed. I wish refunds were possible after spending nearly 30 hours only to find the middle of the game was just hugely irritating. I cannot steer potential buyers away from this game more. Good luck if you decide to buy this, and not because of the format: I have no problem with clear the map" style games if the game content itself is fresh
date: which this game mostly is. Every death in the game just feels like the game doesn't want you to play it. Maybe the extreme feeling of the game being rushed has something to do with the fact that the actual game was built within the last year of development after Ubisoft Massive spent way too much time developing a game engine that has no substantial innovations (gameplay or graphical) above any of the other AAA games built within the last 5 years.\n\nFurthermore

reviewText:
The Division is an cover  TPSRPG with  similar concept  to Borderlands, Defiance or Destiny   that features some really interesting aspect and tedious ones as well. The game is simply gorgeous if you have the system to run the graphics and the physics are great even though dumbed down.
This isn't your regular Arcade twitch shooter nor is it an MMO but it does offer some great mechanic and formula such as the Dark Zone and the story being focused on the city itself rather than your regular run of the mill script.
Although the game is fun in certain aspect there are parts that wasn't. Tech upgrade missions and side missions  being a bit tedious and enemies being a bit unengaging.
It starts off a bit slow like any other rpg then ends up being a bit better as time progress but then doesn't really change from that point on to becoming great to pull you in and stays constantly medicore like any other end game grindfest. Thank god for the Dark Zone

I can recommend this game to people who Looting, playing multiplayer with friends and if you're a stats/gun nut. Not my cup of tea but can see potential for improvement.
35-40 hours to get to max level 30.

P.S if you didn't even watch the video or read that this isn't my type of game as I don't personally recommend it to certain players (see bottom) and the fact that I gave it a recommendation for the people specifically who enjoys this type of genre then you've failed really hard to understand the meaning of this review at all.


Video Review https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZaawJANnIhA&feature=youtu.be
Pros
+ Great graphics and physics even though the game is dumbed down from what is seen from E3. The physics of blowing car windows, tires, things flying around etc can be seen.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=641421446

The penalty for accidentally shooting another player leaves you with the loss of an entire level (rank), 20% of your total currency, and all of the items in your inventory. reviewText:
Ok steam here is my third recommendation, I have gone from not recommending, to recommending and now i am going back to not recommending. This is why:

The GOOD

● Amazing detailed map, credit due**
● Really good graphics
● Detailed modeled and textured Characters
● Pacing & story feels ok the first 15 levels
● The user interface looks good**
● Good cover system
● Base building/upgrading (Wish there was more)
● Dark Zone** (First couple times in there is really exciting and nerve racking)
● Can Fast travel**
● Crafting is ok (Feels good getting a good role)
● I was super Hyped ever since first trailer**
● Darkzone with Friends is super fun!!
● Challenging mission late game is super fun with friends!!
I actually asked steam for a refund but then i had at the time to many hours. I then started playing with friends and got very addicted and kept me playing till now.
**There are exceptions**

AND THE BAD

● Character creation very limited
● Map is lifeless
(Completing the main quest changes nothing, just no more enemies.)
● Transport
(There is none, you will be doing a lot of walking and i mean a lot)
● Story is very average and forgettable (I can't remember any characters except the doctor that is a lesbian)
● Boring Boss fights
(They are just tanky, except for the enemy agents and a helicopter are more interesting wish there where more and more variety)
● Stupid AI
(This could have been over looked, but all the enemies are the same for all factions: rushers, soldiers, grenadiers, snipers, heavies, it gets boring after couple hours)
● Dark Zone
(The dark zone has balancing issues, or you easily kill someone or someone easily kills you there is no middle ground if there is i haven't had those engagements)
● Going Rogue is heavily penalised
(They have fixed this in update)**
● Lack of Dark Zone mission content
(Kill mobs that's it)
● Crafting (This becomes very grinding, trying to get parts, money becomes obsolete and it all revolves around parts and phoenix points)
● Grinding end game
(I’ll say it again it's all just about farming parts and pheonix points to get the best weapons, and gets very boring)(Maybe it will get better with the expansions)
● Collectables and echos are unnecessary
(could have been replaced with more interesting content)
● Fast travel loading times is painfully slow (even worse after one update)
● Missing content
(many things that got me exited from the E3 2013 trailer didn't make it in the game)
● Server issues (Mike should be fired!)
● Day one issues (After 2 lengthy Alpha and Beta)
(Small point, you cant preview clothing so you have to go through all of them and put on every piece to see how it look, this is so unnecessary )


Look I really want Ubisoft to make a good game, but its seems its the same story as with Watch Dogs. I don't know if i trust the Ubisoft brand anymore to deliver good content. Listen this game has potential, really it has, but as for now, like most reviewers out there that say this game is average(Lookup angry joe review for example ), I can't recommend it for now.

Thank you for reading and taking the time, hope this helps you and thumbs up if you agree!

reviewText: Tom Clancy's The Division is quite possibly the most disappointing gaming experience I've ever had from a AAA title. The game has two great things going for it: an incredibly immersive environment and a great co-op system. Everything else is either average or severely lacking. The sticky cover system is as obnoxious as the worst of the ME offerings (which have been out long enough to have been improved upon, imho). Looting employs at least three different mechanics, making it confusing and annoying, especially in co-op mode. Gear and weapons equip mechanics are fine, except for the fact that crafting and loot are so grindy and random that it takes any enjoyment out of getting a new item or gearing up. You want to be happy that you just downed an elite and got a new weapon, except that weapon isn't the type you prefer, and even if it were, the stats are mostly useless to your preferred style of play. Some sort of voucher system that allows players to choose and customize weapons is desperately needed. But, when you look at the crafting and vendor systems more closely you realize this is an intentional handicap to force players to grind endlessly for gear.\n\nBuying items from vendors while leveling is impossible without deliberately adding in grind time. The average piece of loot is worth maybe 300 - 500 credits, but items are easily 50-100x that, and later game items, what few there are in vendors, hit hundreds of thousands. Even if you do find items you can afford, the stats are unlikely to suit you. Once you unlock recalibration you can reroll" one single stat on an item for a hefty fee
recommended: meaning you can easily spend 40k on a single stat reroll for a single semi-end-game item and get no improvement. None! And that’s just regular credits. There are three kinds of credit systems in the game. For end game schematics you need between 80 and 180 special “phoenix” credits. Put into perspective daily quests reward 15-20 of these. So if you do the 3 daily quests
hoursPlayed: it takes 3-5 days for a blueprint for an end-game weapon or other piece of gear. Then
voteText: you'll have to gather the materials to craft it repeatedly until you get some combination of stats you want. Then you’ll still probably have to reroll a recalibration using your regular credits on at least 1 stat. It's a ridiculous system that only serves to invest players in grinding out the same handful of daily missions over and over or in promoting the PVP area which is also lackluster. Defeat the "end boss" in most any other game and you might expect to get your pick of a great weapon. Not in The Division. Here you get a "meh" handgun. Because in a game filled with automatic weapons and sniper rifles
helpfulPercent: what everyone's after is an average handgun with a single mod slot. Boy
votesHelpful: did I feel rewarded.\n\nIf only the disappointments were limited to loot
votesTotal: but this game fails to deliver on every level. It's an elaborate and richly decorated hamster maze with barely enough cheese to keep you motivated. Honestly
votesFunny: if a friend hadn't forked out $60 buying it for me
commentsCount: I wouldn't have bothered playing beyond the first few hours. It is one of the most cynically designed games I've ever seen put out by a major company. Everything about it only serves to offer the least to the gamer in the expectation that you’ll be so dazzled by the environment and bored you’ll pump hours of play time into utter mediocrity. There was no effort here to make a great game or to tell a great story. This game is all about seeing how to stretch the most amount of money out of the least amount of content.\n\nThe only thing I enjoyed about this game was the ease with which I could play with friends during the PVE main plot. Instead of most games where you can only group with friends meaningfully in battlegrounds or PVP areas

reviewText:
I've been struggling writing a review for this game mostly because I was pretty sure to give it a thumbs up.

TL;DR : If you have friends and are ready to commit: 8/10
If you're alone and want the online experience : 5/10
If you just want to play the story mode : 6/10
If you like grinding: 7/10
If you don't: 4/10
-------------------------------------------------------
- Short summary: Don't get me wrong, I really liked playing The Division, it was a very decent action tps. With a great story line, fun gameplay and even if the entire experience was repetitive I didn't really feel it.

- Ubisoft:  Even if Ubisoft is garbage, with poop servers, and poop bugs, it was ok.

- The Dark Zone:  God knows how excited I was to leap into it. Find Rogue Agents, Kill them, bring them to justice by myself. Nope, not happening, you will barely see anyone in it, and whenever you do, they'll either try to kill you while you're not watching them, or gang up on you (3v1 fun), or they will wait for you to extract your items (because you loot them from the DarkZone and have an action to perform to get them out of there) kill you, take all of your work and then extract your items for themselves. I loved the idea. But I like to play alone in MMORPG and this is literally impossible, no way you'll succeed. This is why having friends playing the game is a must-have.

- Interaction with other players: Null, void. There's nothing, you can only meet other players in Safehouses or the DZ that you're in for 2 reasons, you're starting up and discovered them for missions or you died. Talking to people suck balls, and the grouping system will then be mostly random for most of the players.

-The grinding: If you didn't join The Division near the begining or soon after. Good luck to catch up with people. If you are a grindaholic, it might be possible, and then go on ahead. You will be able to grind very challenging missions to get some credits, then some parts" to craft them and do it again. Until... forever.

[ I actually really like grinding in games
date: so I didn't mind that part. Except
recommended: that it's taking literally too long alone for very small results ].\n\nI had a lot of fun

reviewText:
Okay. First off let's knock out some possible misconceptions.

1) It's not a true MMO. It's not one gigantic open world where you see all the other players with everything that goes along with it. It's a lot like Diablo or Borderlands where, depending on your game settings, people can drop in or out at will.

2) It's not a fps game. Seriously. It's an RPG wrapped up in a tps covershooter costume. If you go into this thinking or hoping its an fps and playing it as an fps you're going to get yourself killed ingame, and be very very disappointed.


Now some of the good/bad points

a) As of this post, the game is still in its first week of release. Yes, there will be some issues that haven't been resolved from launch just yet - the game isn't an MMO, but it's multiplayer enough that it's going to be tweaked and fixed over time.

b) The game is gorgeous. The new Snowdrop engine is just absolutely beautiful. The game has some of the best weather and fire effects I've seen in any game ever.

c) The Dark Zone is not fair. It will never be fair. It was never designed to be fair. You will die. You will get ganged up on. You will get shot in the back of the head before you realize anyone is nearby. Suck it up and move on, because war is hell.

d) If your play area is noisy, for the love of Gygax put your mic on ptt. You're annoying everyone you pass by because the game has proximity chat. Basically if you have a headset and you're not muted, everyone can hear you. This goes double if you're in the dz and you're trying to be stealthy.

e) Don't rush the game. There are tons of easter eggs and extra things to find that are just plain awesome. Take the time and explore, find hat there is to find, search out all the lore items. You won't be disappointed.

----

All in all, I highly recommend the game. It's worth your time and money.

reviewText:
When The Division was teased for people to get them hyped, the game looked amazing. They promised so much and gave a hell of a show when promoting the game. So we waited. We sat on our hands and waited in order to keep from clapping at the idea of being able to roam around in a world so vast and changing, acquiring loot, meeting friends, and forming expansive teams along the way. The game looked awesome and boasted a lot of things to occupy your time. Then....it released.

Graphics were dumbed down. Gameplay was repetitive. There was no guild/clan features. Matchmaking was buggy. Weapon and Gear bonuses and stats were incorrect. This plot of this game shifted from fighting in an environment that was devastated by a virus and more of a giant bug collection where you fumbled and crawled your way through all the pain brought on by the issues in the game just to experience what it was like to level up. And Ubisoft/Massive did little to help. Even now, after rolling out patch 1.2, they have broken more than they fixed. In fact we're all sure that they fixed nothing and uploaded a compiled file of bugs into the game instead. So let's list what we have here. Please read this carefully before you ever consider purchasing....or even playing for free.

Pros ::
- The Game looks gorgeous
- The equipment system is lovely
- The personal appearance is pretty entertaining
- Static clutter and objects are plenty and not stationary. (Shoot that rat. Smack that lamp)
- The sounds are great. The ambience is just intense with headphones, which is good.
- There are plenty of missions to choose from for the first 30 hours
- The weapon modification system is nice
- The gunplay is pretty decent

Cons :: (Hold on to your hat)
- There are bugs. Bugs everywhere. I mean seriously, this game is made of bugs.
- There is no customer service
- Patches break a LOT more than they fix
- Gameplay is VERY repetitive
- NPCs can shoot through walls
- Players get locked out of instances
- Upon joining a match, there is a high chance you will fall through the map, get teleported out, and fall again.
- Graphical bugs left and right. You'll see the poly blocks floating around where fog should be, etc.
- The storyline is extremely boring
- The game is nothing like the trailers. It has been dumbed down
- The content you see from the E3 promotions? Totally inaccurate
- The NPCs are all pretty much the same, only some have flamethrowers and some have armor.
- The loading screens are EXCESSIVE. Every single thing you do prompts a loading screen. If you join a group from matchmaking, you load for 2 minutes. They can kick you during that 2 minutes. So your load screen resets before you even load in and, what, you're dropped where they SHOULD have been. Then it teleports you back to a safehouse and you load for another 2 minutes. Even for High end PCs, the load times are far too long and there is a sickening amount of things that call for them.
- The Matchmaking, frankly, sucks. It will not match you with people within the range of your gear. So if you're trying to gear up, it just tosses you in an open slot. And if that group is geared and they don't like that you're not, you get booted. This makes joining groups for get into the DZ and missions in order to even get gear HARD. Of course, you get kicked and get to see those neat load screens.
- The latency is iffy. I personally run on a fiber connection and the amount of lag that I see is ridiculous. You'll watch people scoot down walls. You'll see yourself teleport several feet from where you took cover. Etc.
- The cover system is ALMOST acceptable, but it's not. Having your cover system default to the same button as your roll button is just bad. You'll try to move into cover and roll right past it.
- A lot of the NPCs are overpowered. This game is punishment if you have to fight a group of NPCs that have shotguns. Not only can they 1 shot you, but they have armor. And they don't take cover and play smart. They RUSH you without regard of their own health. You have to pray that you and your group (if you have one) can kill them before they get close.
- The DZ is boring. It's a lot of running around, shooting NPCs to get another level ladder crawling up, hoping you get loot. Then you get it, try to get back to extract it, and bam : some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ that is leagues above you kills you JUST to kill you. But, the DZ is one of the better places to get gear. Well tough ♥♥♥♥. Then again not a lot of people go Rogue since there's no benefit from it. The DZ is just boring.
- It's also impossible to get a good DZ group unless you just run into someone in there and they decide to join you. Matchmaking is useless for this.
- There is no endgame. Once you hit level 30 and fill out your equipment with Highend equipment....eh. You can go after and hunt the gearsets, but that's really just doing the same mission over and over and over and over and over and over and hoping that if something drops it's not the EXACT SAME THING you already have.
- There is no clan/guild system. You can't do something as basic as create a clan/guild name, invite friends, and have a system to talk to people when in game. Oh no. you have to relay your conversations through Uplay IF you can meet anyone that plays in game....because, really, the game is pretty much dead.
- Lastly for my list is that Ubisoft/Massive doesn't care. They promoted this game. They promised so much. They have so many resources available to make this an amazing experience...but they don't. Bugs that are gamebreaking are left in the game. Right now if you join a group, your UI doubles and you can't use it. This has led to people losing items. Gear. Skills being changed mid fight and wiping a group, etc. Where is the company? Where is the customer support? They're nowhere to be found because they have the money and that's the end of it.

This is an example of a DECENTLY enough game that's good for wasting time, if you're bored and have nothing better to do, that could have been great. Ubisoft/Massive failed this title. They got everyones hopes up, sold the game, and backed off. When other games do this, they get taken down from Steam and there is a widespread refund spree, but not in this case. People are still PRAYING that it gets as good as it should be and hold on by the skin of their teeth...but it won't. It's like they have 5 people who work on this title...2 days a week...for a few hours...and only if they want to. They let the community down. They let the Tom Clancy name down. They let every single person who spent $60 on this game down. And not because they didn't give us a decent platform to start with...but because once they realized they messed up they quit caring about it and us.

The Divison has been broken since day one. Almost everything they promised they removed. It's not as lush, vibrant, and expansive as they promised it was. We got the Hook and Switch. Now it's struggling to maintain an 8000 playerbase. So before you spend your hard earned money on this title...just don't. This is the game that COULD HAVE BEEN amazing, but it wasn't. This is the game that robbed us of our enthusiasm. This is the game that is dying a very sad and lonely death.

reviewText:
Not necessarily a 10/10, but definitely an 8/10.

- The only server hiccups were on launch day, for an hour. That's it.
- The black screen on start of the game can be solved by Alt+enter.
- Enemies aren't that big of a bullet sponge unless you're doing missions on hard, or you're below the recommended level.
- Enemies in the darkzone, especially those in the landmarks are bullet sponges. But you can use explosive bullets or incendiary ammo to overcome that. Still, the enemies could definitely chug your ammo reserve.
- Graphics are a blast in this game. GTX- 980 here, Runs on ultra with 55 to 65 fps. Messing with a couple of settings (a mixture of high and medium with SMAA in HIGH) gives me a  consistent 80+ fps.
- I'd recommend playing with friends though. Solo's fine too, but it's hilarious trying to complete missions having a higher recommended level while playing with a group (obviously on harder settings). 2 Rikers with shotguns chased 3 of us from the 3rd floor to outside the building.
- Dark Zone's fun. It's the best part of the game. The tension during a crowded extraction point is surprisingly fun. Plenty of rogues around to chase after. Also going rouge for 60 seconds gives you abour 300+dz credits. So, there's incentive into going rogue too.

reviewText:
Initial Rating 8/10
Rating While Playing Solo 6/10
Rating While Playing Co-op/PvP Groups 9/10

This game (All though I am a traditional MMO fan. WoW and such.) is a MMO like Destiny.
Has a loot system similar to Diablo/Borderlands.
Completely gear dependent/driven scaling mechanics.
Yes, there is bullet sponging; like any other MMO out there.
Yes, its core mechanics will end up being repetitive; like any other MMO out there.

Overall, The Division gives us a fresh take on what we consider MMORPG.
The use of Third Person, Cover Based shooting hasn't been done in a RPG feel. The Division does a excellent job in providing for that mechanic throughout it's various encounters and PvP zones.

I will advise that people who expect this game to be like CoD, CS:GO, or GOW will not have a very enjoyable time.
You cannot just start running into a group of 5 to 10 NPCs and expect to win.
You cannot come into the game and expect to take on Players or NPCS high level than you with ease.
This game is a time sink; meaning that you are required to put some playtime down to get to the point of dominating the majority of challenges in this game.
You have to work, craft, and tweak your gear to specific play styles and talent/ability builds to fully maximize your usefulness in combat. You can't run in with a bunch of green items and be on a level playing field with somebody with blue items who has reconfigured the stats to maximize their damage with weapon or skill.
You can expect to unload FULL CLIPS into people's heads and not kill them if you don't play this game like an MMORPG.

I've played The Division in the last two betas along with launch. This game has HUGE potential to be a great game.
The story is great. The challenges are fun and can be difficult. Playing with a group (of 4) maximizes the chaos and entertainment in the game. Challenges scale with group size.

If you want a Third Person Cover Based MMORPG, this is a game for you.
You want a game to play with friends and enjoy working together, this is a game for you.

If you want to run around trying to 360 no scope headshot people, this game is not for you.
If your looking for a action shooter that involves W+M1 or just running and gunning, this game is not for you.

reviewText:
After hitting level 30 I finally feel like I've experienced everything there is to do in this game. That is to say that I've done all the story missions and the same 3 side missions over and over until I hit level 30.

So far I'm feeling like there's absolutely no end game content at this point and there's nothing to do for level 30's except get killed by hackers in the dark zone. Yes, this game is FULL of hackers at level 30. The user's weapon stats are all saved client side and there's no check in place to make sure the files are unmodified so people can edit their stats to have damage be 1,000,000 (literally) and their armor stat be over 5,000 and they run around the darkzone just killing people for fun. (Edit:) I've looked into this issue more on the steam forums, and from my investigation, people are using CheatEngine. The simplest and most widely known file modification program around. I simply can't believe that Ubisoft didn't foresee this issue before the game launched since there was 'hacking' in the beta as well. Actually I can, it's Ubisoft. I've had this happen many times after reaching level 30.

reviewText:
7/10

If you played the beta and still bought the game afterwards it should be exactly what you expected. The game seems to get this bad rep from 4 groups of players.
-Players who did enough research of the game to get hyped but not enough to realize whether or not the hype was warranted (just checkout beta videos or streams)
-Players who's computers are starting to get a bit dated (upgrade your GPU and you'll stop having the issues)
-Players who don't play MMO-RPGs (yes you will do repetitive stuff for loot, yes the enemy difficulty has a lot to do with how much health it has)
-Players who play MMO-RPGs and expected this to be as massive as WOW (note: WOW has a $15/mo subscription and has been out for 10+ years, people would cry over vanilla wow if it was released nowadays too)

Just realize this game is decent. Not great, not terrible, but pretty good. You must be new here if you didn't expect a server issue or two on game launch. Find a friend or two, wander around abandoned NYC killing gang members and upgrading your gear/skills/home base. Do I expect to be rushing home in 3 months with excitement to get my character stronger? No. Am I rushing home today to play? You better believe it. Oh yea and get used to cover and doing jumping jacks.

reviewText:
First off i want to say i have enjoyed this game to a certain degree and i will amend this to a thumbs up in a month or two when most of the bugs have been ironed out.

I loved the premis of the story, virus hits New York and you're one of the first in a second wave of deep cover operatives to try and sort it out, this is great to start with but doesn't really go anywhere, the missions just end without much of decent ending which could be because of the next years of content to be released but i personally would have liked a solid ending and more set up for the next DLC but there really isnt any.

Considering how long this game took to be produced through all the testing (closed and open) there are bugs aplenty, from silly overpowered mobs that just charge at you with no tactics involved ,cover not working as you would expect and random mobs spawning from nowhere and murdering you before you can dice for cover and hit your fast heal.

But it does look fantastic,the scenery and the weather effects are the best I'v seen in a fair while.

PRO'S
Looks fantastic
Co-op is awesome
Alot of skill needed and feels good to complete a hard mission
Generally good gameplay
Has a very diablo feel to the game with stats and loot
Addictive!

CON'S
Lots of bugs still
Darkzone is very tough when you hit lvl 30 and punishment is very severe for going rogue(its easy to lose a days worth of xp in one death)
Worst AI i think i have ever experienced
Seems like there only a dozen enemy models in the whole game
Seems to be unbalanced with certain weapons
With the exception of a few missions it's VERY repetative as in the same mission just in different areas
Not friendly towards solo players when entering the DZ(you will get slapped around ALOT and can be frustrating if you just helped them beat a mob rush)

Like i said before, i have enjoyed this game(over 40 hours of play) but it has the feel of certain Play For Free titles and i expected more considering its hefty price, is this a $60 game? not yet in my opinion,a $30 game?would be more suited to the experience myself and friends have had.

reviewText: I really wanted to love this game, but am ultimately disappointed. As a whole this game is super repetitive and boring. Once you get to lvl30 you will literally do the same handful of things over and over and over and over... The dark-zone isn't fun at all, you run a farming route or get killed by rogues, over and over and over... Even with the new patch, it's more of the same tired old stuff that we have already done a thousand times. The game is just a REALLY long grind for some perfect piece/set of gear that is ultimately useless once you get it. There's no sense of reward or accomplishment, just time wasted. I'm all for wasting my time and everything, but there's much better ways to do it than by playing The Division. I really would like to recommend this game but I just can't.

reviewText:
I would not tell anyone to get this game in it's current state, but after they patch this game for a few months, it will be a lot more enjoyable. This game is fun, but the end-game just isn't satisfying at all.

- The Dark-Zone is a PvP zone where there is little to no PvP. If you do decide to shoot another player and go Rogue, the reward to punishment ratio for not making it out of the Rogue state is 1-20. So why would you risk going rogue for +1000xp when you die and get -20,000 xp, -30,000 DZ funds, -# DZ Keys?

- There are multiple areas of the Dark zone that don't even work (i.e. Mid-town Music, Abandoned Gas Station,etc). On top of that, some areas don't even respawn when they should so you will have areas listed as active where there is no loot and no enemy NPC's.

- Shotgun rushes on challenging missions. Yes you can complete the mission, but get used to falling back and playing like a puss.

-DELTA error. This game has a lot of server issues where you will just dc in the middle of a fight and then spawn back in right on top of enemies.

---
This game is great while you are leveling, but as soon as you enter the end-game raids or the Dark Zone, prepare to enter the most boring/frustrating grind in an rpg." Just wait for it to be patched cause everyone who didn't is annoyed."

reviewText: I told my grandma that I was excited for this game. I showed her the e3 trailer from years ago and she said it looked amazing. My grandma was in the hospital this past weekend. I visited her today and she reminded me that the Division comes out tonight. I said I know, I have to leave the hospital early so I can play it when it launches. Her last words to me before she passed was Have fun playing the Division." I sped home to play and I couldn't even log on. This was my grandmas dying wish and Ubisoft couldn't make it happen. I'm letting my grandma down by not playing it at launch. I'm sorry Grandma. I'm sorry."

reviewText: I really tried to enjoy The Division. I will keep trying to enjoy The division. But it has some major problems. Is it open world? Sure. But is there anything to do in the open world? Walking from mission to mission with no filler in between is all you get. How about diversity in the world, or characters? absolutely none, every enemy is the same. All the players look the same. the NPC chatter is AWFUL. the repetitiveness in the missions and world is AWFUL. The gun play is alright. nothing you havent done before. the gear level set up is mind boggling. I have a level 5 police M4, and a level 8 police M4. the difference is one miraculously shoots magical bullets that do more damage to the bullet sponges that is the Division AI..\n\nIf Rinse and Repeat is your style and you like looting then by all means git it a whirl. like i said, im going to keep on trying to enjoy this game.  But it genuinely feels like a generic repetitive piece of mediocre overhyped trash, at the moment.

reviewText:
I've put alot of time into this game... I really wanted to like it. It looks beautiful. I love the concept.. I keep hearing people complaining about the same enemy types.. This is Tom Clancy.. If you want yet another Zombie game move along.  People also keep talking about how the enemies are bullet sponges.. Thats any game, the enemies get tougher and so do you.. Thats what keeps you playing, one shotting everything isnt fun. perhaps you are burnt out on video games and maybe need to move along.

To UBI: The story as weak is it is.. Keep that team.  The people who created the cities, lighting effects, sounds all around graphic team keep them.. How ever who ever came up with the spawn points, enemy AI and the balancing ♥♥♥♥ING FIRE THEM.

I cant tell you how many times I fought for 5 or more min to clear out npcs for an extraction site only to have them spawn the moment I start to put my gear on the rope and they kill me before I can extract.. Seriously ♥♥♥♥ the dark zone.. You've got sewer rat players who way out lvl people and just wait till you clear out an area and then just walk up kill you and take all the stuff you worked so hard for.. Not to mention the loss of XP which takes time, time which I put into this game out of my own personal life and just to have that ripped away because of some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ hyped up on mountain dew? No thanks.. Another thing ♥♥♥♥ the camera angles.. I was really hesitant about buying this game because I am not a fan of 3rd person shooters but I finally picked it up after just seeing how pretty the game was.. Also I like the type of loot system the game has.  But more often than not I'd get the camera crammed in the back of my characters head so I couldnt see what I was shooting at and would end up dying..

Sorry I am all over the place and this review has no order but thats pretty much how the game is.. Oh you just fought your ♥♥♥ off killing npcs that can two shot you for 10 min straight? Cool! Now extact your ♥♥♥♥!  Lets say all things go right here.. You get your ♥♥♥♥ on the rope and the chopper is about to take off.. Okay now random ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ players are coming along and fighting you.. Maybe you're getting the upper hand here... Oh no the game doesnt like that.. LETS ♥♥♥♥ UP YOUR VIEW BY PUTTING WHAT YOU EXTRACTED HUGE IN THE CENTER OF YOUR SCREEN SO YOU CANT SEE..
I have to stop just thinking about this ♥♥♥♥ stain is getting my blood pressure up.

TLDR;  Good game if you like Diablo style drop rates, I suggest only playing with friends because everyone is a ♥♥♥♥♥♥. Game breaking cover system just isnt realiable. The game has great potential but there are so many things that make it more frustrating that its worth I just cant recomend it.
