reviewText:
(Edit: Just finished fully upgrading my base, hit level cap and finished the story missions and almost all of the sidequests. I enjoyed the game more than I thought I would but I probably won't play much more of it. I only encountered a few minor bugs (stuck in a wall once and got knocked down in a mission and wouldn't fully die. The game is solid but doesn't seem to offer that much in the long run for a solo player.)


Overall I am enjoying this game but I'm not sure that I would recommend it.

Gameplay is repetitive but not that much worse than most MMO style games.

Encountered a few graphical issues (bodies floating after death, screen flashing and models for different environments fading in over each other.

I've been stuck twice by climbing on top of something then coming down the opposite side and getting trapped behind different objects (had to fast travel out of one of them and had to blow myself up with grenades the second time)

The difficulty level is pretty low for the PVE stuff (haven't tried pvp yet). I've been running the game solo at a slow pace to explore but the random side and event quests are quite repetitive.

I wish that there was more enemy types but those may appear later.

The game is decent for a cover shooter and I hope more gets added in with the upcoming dlc.

reviewText:
The bad

The amount of bugs and glitches in this game would even shame Bethesda.

The dark zone is a complete mess, there needs to be more than just the under 160 and above 160 gear score zones. Hackers are running rampant in the dark zone, I am fine with getting destroyed by some one with better gear or better skill but having hackers telaport around and wasting the entire server is just a joke.

The games content is extremely grindy even before end game, every mission or encounter is the exact same.

Incursion is just one giant meat grinder. Survive wave after wave in the same small area, with 0 save points. I can understand why people would rather glitch it then run it right, there is nothing rewarding about the gameplay in this mission.

The Good

The game looks great, does it look as good as they promised, no but it still looks great.

The atmosphere is amazing, this alone is keeping me playing the game.

This game has great potential but needed another year in development.

reviewText:
For a Triple-A game, this title was quite lackluster. The story starts of intruiging and captivating, and after a few hours into the game it continues to be so. However, from a gameplay standpoint the game never changes. It's always one of a few events pulled out of a grab bag for what encounter you'll experience next when completing missions. However, this is a cross breed of an MMO and a Third-Person-Shooter, so some grinding and repetition is to be expected, but i feel as if the balances in this game between innovative gameplay and senseless repetition are off.

The graphics in this game are quite gorgeous, and the audio is very nice. There were some graphical bugs, but not anything I felt the need to become exasperated over, since no game is without some bug and this one was minor.

Overall, barring more specific examples, this game is a midly interesting production of a corporation who uses a buisnessmans approach to a game rather than an artists approach. It could have been done better, but it could have also been worse. For the price, i don't reccommend this game.

reviewText:
Yet another open world Ubisoft game that somehow manages to ruin the idea of exploring an open world through generic side-quests, an overzealous minimap/waypoint system, and the idea that the main goal of playing an open world game is collecting 50 of whatever.

Please... for the sake of your art and tech guys, who have realised a beautiful and visually interesting postapocalypic Manhattan, take a look at Bethesda's games for how to make open world titles that immerse and engage the player rather than make everything a chore. As a player there's a massive frustration in seeing something that could have been an absorbing and amazing game reduced to tedium by the design rather than technical or artistic limitations.

This is before we get to the darkzone stuff which is meant to be endgame, but there's still some clear design confusion over whether this is meant to be a long-term MMO or short-term story with multiplayer tacked on. It's a decent concept but at the moment broke in the implementation, and quickly becomes a grind with a clear risk/reward issue around going rogue. In terms of multiplayer (and overall game) longevity, this is Borderlands - there's some, but nobody still plays Borderlands now, right?

In summary, this is not a *bad* game, but comes frustratingly - visually and technically - close to being an amazing one, then is massively let down by game design to below mediocrity.

reviewText:
This game at the beginning of its life cycle was pretty good. People were enjoying it, yet there were still bugs and glitches, but it was still a great game.
It all got ♥♥♥♥ed over when Ubishit tried updating aspects of the game. Instead of just fixing things, they created new problems from those fixes. And it just kept adding up and up and up until it became a ♥♥♥♥♥torm.
The addition of new content was short breaths of fresh air. Fresh, yet short lived. A lot of what made grinding for gear fun was completely wiped and those that were lucky to become OP in the early stages of the game have become even more OP. A complete divide between OP players running around going rogue in the Dark Zone and other players looking to get better loot because things like Incursions are either too difficult, not their level, not their taste or simply dont want to, getting screwed over by higher levels.
The Dark Zone (PVP) aspect of the game was great. People could gather loot, extract it without worrying about it being taken away, all the while facing competition from AI or other players, which was a tremendous idea.... until update 1.2. Update 1.2 now allowed players in the dark zone to steal the loot off of other people as they were extracting. Now, instead of extracting and leaving to get more loot, now you have to make sure you protect it, which was an incredibly dumb idea. The moment I heard about that part of the update, was the moment I knew that the game had seriously gone downhill, and that Ubisoft had not only completely screwed over fans, but also screwed over their game
Overall, if this review came out a week after launch, it would have been a solid 7/10 for me. But now, it drops down to a dissapointing 3/10
Pick it up, Ubisoft. First the AC trilogy goes downhill, now this? This is definitely not their best work. For a better experience, go get Rainbow Six Siege, which is still under the Tom Clancy name. A much better game, and will keep you engaged for longer.

reviewText:
The division is a good game, but the lack of end game is ridiculous. You can be max level in a single day and can have complete all the content in like 2 days or so. The pvp is bad, nobody want to play rogue except for party that just want to chill for some hours. You have no big reward being a rogue so why would peoples risk their ranks/$$/loots to do so..

-Yea indeed the graphics are absolutly amazing.
-The cover system is pretty good.
-The AI is good, they will adapt their strategy in combat situatuon. (patchs are still needed to fix some problems/stupid decision)
-The balance between some levels is just stupid from level 19 to 20 i gain like X2 max hp.
-The farming system is just broken (You leave a safe house, kill a yellow boss nearby, return to the safe house (like 1 minute or so), then repeat theses steps...) A lot of players are doing that so no need to get to the dark zone.
-There is no player to player trading system
-The game is very repetitive, i think there are 5 side missions type or so

I dont recommend this game because its not worth 80$. Ubisoft still have many issues to fix, add more content for free

reviewText: Purchased this game for its full price of $60.  After buying this game I will be more careful in my future purchases. This game is not worth the asking price.  The trailer that originally got me interested in the game is nothing like what it really is. The end product is a Destiny wannabe with zero Tom Clancy feel.  The story is bland and the voice acting is just pathetic.  Zero effort to make you feel like you are a special agent helping save a city.  You start the game off like most by making your character.  This game is sappose to be new and amazing and the character creation options are barren.  Its almost a slap in the face how few options there are.  You get very little customization so you end up looking like every other Agent running around.   The Dark Zone is the only open world part, and most likely people will only be trying to kill you there instead of team up or help obtain loot.  Leveling up from 1-30 can be fun at times but there is alot of running around.  You can fast travel back and forth but it still makes getting around boring.  I guess bikes and cars got affected by the Virus???  Once you get to lvl 30 the game kind of hits the brakes.  The only goal you will have is to better your gear.  Sadly the end game is where the lack of content is.  Your options are go to the Dark Zone and hope you get lucky there or do dailies for Phoenix Credits and buy fancy blueprints from the vendors.  Even after farming the Dark Zone and farming Phoenix credits  there is still a lack of things to do.  They make you replay the same missions over and over and over.   I feel as if they just rushed this game out and its missing so much content.  They are trying to sell you a $60 completed game but its not worth it in the end with a lack of things to even keep you wanting to play more..  Wait till it's super cheap or get it for free if offered with some new computer parts you purchased.  I got my 100 + hours out of it and I guess thats the only posotive.  I'd suggest staying away from this game until it gets its ♥♥♥♥ together. I know Tom Clancy is rolling over in his grave right now.

reviewText:
听说全境也要拍电影了，于是来说说两个月没玩的这个游戏。
说实话，beta试玩时，这个游戏着实让我眼前一亮，新颖的玩法着实有趣。于是毫不犹豫的预购了豪华版。

游戏发售后，第一时间就开始了游玩之旅。尽管刚开始土豆服务器频繁抽风，游戏bug也层出不断，但阻挡不了我的热情，育碧也敬业的稳定了服务器，没几天我就把主线任务做完，等级刷到了满级，也时不时去暗区闯闯。但是，没多久这个游戏就开始露出恶意了。
首先，单调的支线任务，主线做完后的每日任务纯粹是为了刷而刷。刷了一段时间就厌倦了（steam上活跃人数的爆减估计就是这个原因），于是就苦等dlc。
等了好久第一个dlc终于上线了，又是第一时间开始游玩，然后，才发现dlc的难度不是一般的难，第二款dlc也是如此。育碧是纯粹的想用难度和装备来留住玩家。并且，新一批bug，包括卡伤害又上线了，玩家总能轻而易举的发现这些bug（都怀疑是不是育碧故意做的hhh）。不管怎么样，我还是很期待机票里的内容(╯з╰)
当然这个游戏的核心便是暗区撕逼。刚开始由于对叛变特工的惩罚力度很大，暗区是十分和谐的。自从育碧调低了惩罚力度，才将暗区彻底变成了撕逼战场。现在没有个挂，谁还敢随随便便进入暗区。由于育碧无法及时有效的对待外挂，导致现在暗区早已成为了神之间的对决（真正的大神和开挂的众神的巅峰对决），我这种凡人完全不敢去高阶区。希望育碧能严肃对待。不过最近dlc对暗区的玩法的提升做的不错(￣∇￣)
总之，希望这个游戏能在机票上面多做些文章，增加些可玩性，也希望电影版能让人满意。

reviewText:
Pros:
1) Graphic. As good as DX11 allow. No any game now can give picture as realistic as this game. Only hairs (all of them) and wanna-be-male females looks ugly, all other stuff just way higher than whole game industry.
2) Smooth and fun low level content. Game are really good before you got level 30.



Contras:

reviewText:
The Division is what you get when you take the game devs that built Far Cry 3, who made a decent 1 player game with some basic multiplayer aspects and a crap poor craft system and charge them with the task of making a MMORPG version of it on the Division IP expecting them to come up with this great MMO style game. (not sure if that's the same crew that did fc3, but the game sure feels like it at its core)

If you compare this game to something like Far Cry 3,
You have a great single player experience, a decent group experience when the grouping system works, the world is buggy but plays well if you stay inside the main flow of the game.
The same crappy craft mentality that FC3 had, cam get some useful stuff early but late game it's trivial.

Now add in some MMO design, all the flaws turns that into a steaming pile game breaking exploits. The fact they have no anti hack system is ridiculous, crappy noname korean MMO's have antihacks...

Also the final nail in the coffin is this is first and foremost a console game, and the PC experience suffers from the lack of detail and attention a game designed for the PC deserves and needs.

reviewText: Ubisoft, this game had so much potential, so many things I was looking forward to.  I followed this game since it was first teased I believe some time back in 2012.  Back then the game looked gorgeous, I remember when the first gameplay trailer came out and the game truly looked like a game of the future, with a dynamic world and stunning picturesque graphics.  I am writing this review out of solemn disappointment as I know many players of this game will agree with me, Ubisoft has really ♥♥♥♥ed up big this time.  I played the game tonight, in hopes of finding any sort of recollection with the game after the 1.2 patch.  Decided to try the new Incursion to see if my problems from the last one were solved.  I have not been able to even remotely come close to finishing either Incursion since they were released.  The only piece of high level gear I have was purchased from a combination of a pheonix credit reward plus farming the daily and weekly missions for a couple of weeks.  The game has turned into a complete and utter disappointment and although I know I will inevitably play it once I know that many of the broken aspects of the game have been fixed, for now, Ubisoft has lost me.  I will end my review by saying one more thing to Ubisoft...LISTEN TO THE COMMUNITY!  WE ARE LITERALLY SCREAMING FOR YOU TO MAKE THIS GAME GOOD FOR |US|, YOUR CUSTOMERS!
voteText: 11 of 12 people (92%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
What a waste of money.  They hyped the crap out of this game and made it look *much* more immersive than it really is.  You spend all your time essentially doing the same thing: killing bad guys who might drop better gear so you can kill tougher bad guys who might drop better gear so you can kill tougher bad guys.....

The sense of realism is pretty good in that they put a rediculous amount of effort into the graphics and details of the world.  The realism shatters however when you realize you can carry many hundreds of bullets, and the enemy bosses are so tough that you'll need every last one and more.  It's no fun to hope for headshots as you dodge a bullet-resistant boss's shots for long stretches at time.  I wonder how much better the game would be if they didn't spend so much effort on the graphics and details and instead went for enhancements to the playability or variety of encounters?

The sense of community is absent.  Sure you can link up with people but the in-game microphone system is not intuitive so everyone I've played with has it on automatic and all I hear is the sound coming out of their speakers, which is usually similar the sound coming out of my headphones but with a delay so I have to turn off the in-game voip completely.  If one dork in the group has it configured wrong, the entire group cannot communicate and the system fails.  So much for teamwork.

Also the game requires a 3rd party always-online account called Uplay.  I hate it when developers force me to use stuff that adds nothing to the game.  Literally nothing.  I can communicate with my friends through Steam, why did the developer spend their resources trying to make a system to compete with that and then force me to use it?  It's stupid.

I'm sad I was suckered into buying this game.  You should learn from my mistake.

reviewText:
Ok first the good. The game itself is well made. Gorgeous environments and the story is actually interesting. Playing on your own going around doing quests, listening to random phone messages, shooting dirtbags and having the story unfold is a lot of fun. I'm a sucker for a fps rpg (I bought a lifetime subscription for Hellgate London.. it uh.. didn't work out) and this one has great weapon itemization a fun story and a combat system that while not overly complex doesn't get boring after a handful of firefights.

Now the bad. While there is a great variety of weapons to use they missed the mark on character customization. Very few options when creating your character to make it unique. BUT they may have thought of this because there are seemingly hundreds of vanity items you can collect to customize your character. Hooray!!.. well NO because it's 500 hats all called different things that look the same. No matter how much you mix and match you will still look like everyone else. Unless perhaps you pay real money and buy an outfit pack for $5. Then you might look a LITTLE different. A deal breaker? ehh.. not really but I like to feel my character is unique in my rpgs even if the roleplaying is only in my head.

Now the real bad. The team making decisions on how to manage this game baffles me. Their quality control is a joke. Caught flat out hacking and murdering everyone in sight? Have a 3 day vacation, keep all those items you got though. Found a glitch that lets you get the finest end game loot with no effort? We will fix that... eventually... but in the meantime farm away. Then when you get bored you can roflstomp the casuals who didn't grind out exploits. They literally put out their first (and likely only) free content addition to the game and within a day tons of people have the best loot in the game without having to earn any of it. why go back and do earlier content for worse gear? Also people doing things legit are even MORE screwed because they made crafting way more expensive. Very low risk to exploit developers mistakes because they don't even ban people using third program hacks!

TLDR: Fun game.. for awhile but unless they get serious about punishing exploiters/hackers the end game is a hot mess and zero fun for anyone.

reviewText:
- Early-access of The Division 2.0 with AAA price tag
- Wait, what?! With all the hours poured in you downvote the game?
- Yes, I do

Review v 1.1

1. World

This stunning hand-crafted NY city is as beautiful as it is empty. When you grinding towards level 30, you are completing unique story missions along with absolutely unimaginative obligatory side missions.  Upon completion of all the activities (takes about 14 hours if you do not rush anything) you are stuck with absolutely useless NY city. There are no real random or special encounters on the streets of NY after you reach level 30. It feels empty and I wonder why the put so many effort in decorating city which is 15-hours-long-and-the-gone.

2. Mechanics

There are a lot of bugs and inconsistencies all over The Division and they all add up to the overall frustrating experience we get as an endgame. From exploits that let players get the loot instantly and then troll the dark zone newbies to bugs with perks and talents, jammed guns and skills delay / miscasts / double cooldowns and so on. Sadly, there is nothing behind that cinematic beauty we have been fed up with but poor execution. I will not be detailed here as there is so much broken in the game that I doubt they can fix it even in a year.

3. Endgame

In my opinion the endgame in The Division is a non-stop mindless grindfest for items that you don’t care about. Maybe a little PvP on top but that’s it. You get the best gear and then you kill all the weaker agents in the dark zone simply because almost everyone are within the same 161+ gear score bracket.

3.1 Loot

Massive is simply screwing people about loot. I do accept that this type of game involves grind but not of extent that you farm dark zone, missions for tens of hours so you get  nothing  better in return. There are different kinds of problems with the loot but the core thing is it  not feels rewarding at all .

3.1.1 Grinding

Believe me when I say this is a mindless grind. It really doesn’t matter whether you exploit or do not (so you will have to waste enormous amount of time as I did) it will take a lot of hours for you to get something useful. It would have been a bit better if you get a truck of useless stuff and then you make something useful from it. But no, the equipment is scarce even though it is complete crap in most of the cases. The  wow effect  will instantly vanish when you see that the first high-end / set item you get is actually worse than your epic purple. And the second, and then the third. Damn, what’s wrong with this game? Have they checked out Diablo 3 and Destiny lessons learned?
Want to add about Division Tech grind. Yes, you can farm it only in the dark zone and it will take ages for you to farm it even with boosted chance of drop because crafting takes so much of it for each ♥♥♥♥ roll you do that you can spend entire weekend for div tech farm ending up with nothing.

3.1.2 Crafting

Generally, crafting it is not a bad thing. Bad thing here is that it is the most reliable way of getting decent equipment. And the most reliable way is full of random. Random stats, random effects, random talents with 90% of them being completely useless. I am extremely lucky that I get best-in-slot guns after 10 to 20 rolls but still I have that amount of hours in because I farm materials for these rolls. I have seen people that exploited hell out of Hornet, Bullet King etc., rolled for hundreds of high-end vector and did not get a single decent one. That’s simply frustrating.
With 1.1 update they aimed to divert people from crafting through.. increasing amount of materials required to craft. Well, that’s cool but it is not punishing at all for exploiters or for those who are already in decent gear (so they farm high-ends for materials) – it is punishing for those who are still level up. You can get decently geared in a day (of playtime) if you have a good team but that is almost a month for casual players (assuming 10 hours/ week or less). Okay, you trying to show people that crafting is not the best way but are there any others really? Sure you can farm DZ for high-ends quickly reaching a certain gear score within 180ish bracket and then slowly making it into 190ish bracket. You can farm Incursion for the 214 gear (challenge mode). With a good team you can do it in 25 mins but I guarantee you will fail at least several times beforehand.

3.1.3 Talents and stats

There are a lot of useless talents and stats on both weapons on gear (say hi to additional experience gain for level 30 characters, but wait, do they need one after they reached the level cap already?). There are a lot of stats that really doesn’t significantly add up to your survival skills. Useful stats and talents compromise something like 10% of all currently in-game. Weapons are simply imbalanced - there are obvious choices for PvP and PvE .

3.1.4 Gear Score

This is innovation made life so easier for.. who exactly? You think that higher gear score is better? Higher rarity of item is better? Well, think again. Same mistake was done in Diablo 3 before Reaper of Souls and here we go again. I have 191gs set items  WAY BETTER than 240gs set items. And that’s not some weird one case – I still have a few 191 pieces I cannot improve after don’t-know-how-many times passed Challenging Incursion.

3.2 Skills and builds

I have experimented with builds for a while but there is nothing in game that really rewards altering your playstyle. Aside from playing technician on Incursion there is no point of other build than “SMG + M1A First Wave, Firearms + Stamina, Pulse + Heal + Survivor Link”. If you claim that your build is better,– you simply haven’t met SMG-M1A build of your level yet.
Spend several hours tweaking your playstyle and equipment and you will see that there are clearly a set of skills that are better than others. There is no real balance here and the game is constantly pushing you to a certain way of playing.
I have to mention “exploit cover” skill, or how Massive calls it – mobile cover. This skill needs to be deleted from the game (sorry, 1% of players) for the greater good.

4. Dark Zone

PvP experience at its finest - thought MassiSoft.

4.1 Area

While it looks big at first, you will soon realize how small it is. You will, literally, farm 4-5 spawn points for materials and div tech all days long. Shoot, extract, run, repeat. The chance of good drop is so small that you can play for 100 hours and get just a couple of decent items. And all glitches and exploits apply to this zone as well.

4.2 Gear score brackets

This system would be nice if we had more gs brackets. Currently, guys with 161gs (~30 hours of play) and 222gs (~250 hours of play assuming best-in-slot gear) are placed within the same zone and so the is how Massive defines PvP experience. A one-shot zone for everyone.

4.3 Cheaters

C’mon, Ubisoft. You are doing this to us over and over again. Anti-cheat system doesn’t exist in Ubisoft titles and this game follows the rule.

This list is in no way an exhaustive list of flaws but it provides the same impression I have about this game. Overall the game is 5/10 at most.. Hope my review helps.

Disclaimer: With all the words said, I still appreciate the work done and I know that developing games is not an easy job. It is just frustrating to see that another promising title turned into who-knows-what due to poor execution. Let's not be too harsh on developers - let them try to fix it.

Ubisoft is very good at marketing and innovating but they suck at execution so much that you will hate yourself for buying their game. Again.

Out of chars.

reviewText:
TL:DR

Interesting story, cool combat, good voice acting, I don't know about the current PVP ( I only played Dark Zone in the betas ).  Good game in my opinion, but don't buy it if you are expecting it to be like DayZ (Survival, heavily based on trying to stay alive in NY) or COD (Fast paced and frantic). More like a modern day Borderlands 2 (Fun looting, good times with your teammates, enjoyable and intriguing story, with a good cooperative element).

I think this game gets too much crap for how good it actually is. I mean half of them are complaints about Uplay, PVP, and downgraded graphics. Give it a shot, and with some friends too.


I got hyped for this game for a couple of reasons. My love for modern day shooters, apocolyptic atmospheres, and the system of looting and advancing your gear to fight other bad guys. The graphics looked great a few years ago, but let's not take about that (P.S. Ubisoft downgraded the graphics hardscore). I played both the closed and open betas. They were very fun and boosted the amount of hype I had for the upcoming title. They were alright except for many bugs and glitches that people exploited. Anyways, let us go on to the game.

Looting System. It's sort of slow-paced. You have to play multiple missions or encounters or side missions to be able to purchase good stuff in the venders and stuff. But it shouldn't be a problem to most people.

Character custumization. Nothing special. You got your basics and some accesories. Not out of the world Black Desert kind of stuff.

User Interface. It looks nice, but it isn't as cool as you would expect in such a big game.

Uplay. Please. For the love of god. Ubisoft can just ♥♥♥♥ off with their stupid--

Story. It's a good one. Even though I haven't finished the game, you can't help but get sucked into it. Without spoiling the plot, each mission slowly builds up into the bigger picture of the story and some will make you think about the actual possibility of a virus spread on banknotes.

Atmosphere. It's beautiful, capturing really good details and areas of modern New York. The roaming civis in the streets struggling are a good plus, as well as the interactive ones that reward you for donating consumables to them.

Combat. As you all know, this is a RPG. That means tanky enemies with high HP. It can be slow and boring by yourself if you don't have the right weapons and gear for the difficulty, but that can be easily fixed by getting a couple of friends to play with you. NPCs all have nice dialouge and good audio to them. The AI is smart but not lifelike.

PVP. I can't say much because I've played like 10 minutes of it since launch. The NPCs have been buffed a lot from the betas, so I would reccommend reaching mid to end game before entering the PVP area.

Overall Score
Looting : 7/10
Graphics : 7.5/10
Story : 10/10
Characters/NPCS : 6.8/10
PVP : N/A
UI : 4.5/10
Uplay : KillYourSelfUbisoft

I like the game, but there are postives and negatives to it. But the pros outweigh the cons, making this a game that I was proud of preordering back in December.

reviewText: This game is a joke now. The amount of hackers in the dark zone and in the game period are ridiculous. A person will work all day to get from 80+ DZ rank, say 83 to 84 , and hacker shows up with saved teleport spots and drop you. The same thing happens if you go rogue too. You're honestly better off trying to farm NPC's with the horrendous XP they give you. Cause heaven forbid if you die you've lost the last hours work. That on;y way you can really defend yourself against the hackers is to A. Stay out of the dark zone, or B. get the hacks yourself but then you get reported and banned for trying to help police the game. The best part about the hackers is that even if you upgrade your anti-cheat, someone will find a backdoor and then the coder will probably make it undetectable if anything and it'll be right back in the game. Maybe there could be a conference between another company that has a badass anti-cheat system and there could be points. As for the mobile cover, this has been a complaint for quite some time and rather than disabling it, you choose to fix mundane things like not having people blow up the APC with sticky bombs in falcon's lost. Sadly, The Division used to be a game a highly recommended to my fellow gamers and now after playing some 300+ it's absolute garbage. It's not even worth the sixty dollars I paid for on steam, I'd have rather spent the money on dark souls.

reviewText:
Tom Clancey's The Division is a complete let down, it has almost nothing going for it, it does not have a good story, it does not have good end-game content, it does not have a good multiplayer experience, it does not have good game mechanics, and it just fails at what it is meant to do. I will be going through everything I mentioned in detail and at the end give it a rating out of 10.

- The only thing you can give this game credit for is the graphics and its amazing recreation of Manhatten. It has some of the best graphics in the industry and features some neat things like global illumination and a descent level of interaction with the enviroment, although sadly graphics cannot make up for the failures this game has.

-The story in the game does not have a purpose and at the end it leaves you wondering what your work meant to the story at large or for the future of the game, you don't make any connections with any characters, and you feel disconnected with the enviroment and struggle shown around you.

-When you complete the lack-luster campaign" you are greeted with four options

reviewText: I really wanted to like the game, but it is just riddled with too many issues for it to be a fun experience. reviewText:
A great game made by Ubisoft, one of the only games I don't mind using Uplay for (as terrible as it is).

The firefights are like any other MMORPG but with the use of assualt rifles, and other gun-type weapons. There's nothing over the top like a flamethrower, this game has a pretty nice sense of reality. Enemies are bullet sponges, but that's how every other MMO chooses to have it, so I never found a problem with it.
Going into a firefight against enemies that are barely higher level then you (3-4 levels higher) shows the balance between them, showing a sign of progression and leveling.

The questing is different in a good and a bad way.
Good way being there is a main story line, each story mission mixes gameplay and story-telling very nicely, although players are usually grinding away at them trying to reach level 30. The main story alone would probably take about 8-10 hours of gameplay, NOT including the side missions and the weapons you have to get to achieve them.

The bad side of questing are the side missions. There's 3 different types of side missions, each one is in a different location (the voice lines in the same type of side mission are literally copied and pasted). There's also encounters, which are almost useles to do until endgame when the main story doesn't give you enough resources to get your main base to 100%.

The weapons are balanced from each other, the better rarity you have the more stats and special weapon unlocks you'll get.

Now the bad part.

The rarity system in this game is TERRIBLE. The system goes as shown, gold being the rarest and highest of value.
[0list]
White
Green
Blue
Purple
Gold

At first, it seems there's nothing wrong with that, but let me explain something else. At level 10-15, you will literally never get a purple for your level, they simply just won't drop, It seems as if the gold weapons wont drop until the max level. These are not showing there level of rarity, but instead they show how high-end they are.

The end game is the #1 thing you'll see people talk a lotta ♥♥♥♥ about, and it's well deserved. The end-game is just straight up BORING. The endgame is grinding for special credits for a special vendor (which to remind you is literally story quests with really hard difficulty). The darkzone is the #1 place you'll be at level 30, because you won't get anything from outside of there. The darkzone is a place where pvp is allowed, but not required. It's so damn stupid to be killed by someone with the overpowered midas or vector, while you're trying to look for one.

The game becomes different near end-game. It becomes unplayable, unfair, and unfun.

If you see this game for $20 on some 3rd-party website, please buy it with your friends and play the story, this game is great with friends. If you still see this game for $60 on Steam, do not buy it, it will never be worth it.

reviewText:
The gaming experience is really terrible. One example is the inventory system. It defaults to sorted by quality. I honeslty don't get why a gun of level 8 is on the top of the list than a gun with a higher level. Even the sorting between DPS is messed up. The game doesn't say why this gun with a lower dps and lower level has more quality than a gun with a higher level and higher dps. The gun selection interface isn't friendly either. I have to select each gun to see what type of gun it is. It isn't sorted by type! I had to select one gun at a time just to know what type of gun I currently have. It's just a pain!

Another one is that you have to hold the button F to do something. The feedback to a player isn't very well designed. It doesn't let the player know if you can now release the F key after holding it for so long. It doesn't say that you have to hold the F key unless you happened to notice that little arrow in the upper hemisphere of the circle to know that you have to hold the F key!

And about the fast travel. Why is it the screen for confirming fast travel and actual fast travel is the same? What I mean is the moving arrow animation to the selected destination for both confirmation screen and actual loading screen! I waited 5 minutes just to notice that I have to confirm fast travel! I don't mind the confirmation function but the ♥♥♥♥ing screen is the same! The only hint that you have that you actually fast travelled is that walking sound after the confirmation screen. It's too soft to notice any difference!

I think the game idea is great but the user experience is so abhorrent.

Don't buy this game even if Emma Watson or Emma Stone goes on a date with you.
Don't waste your bandwidth downloading this game.
Don't even torrent this game as to prevent it from spreading on the internet.
Just don't

reviewText: 158 hours in. Do not recommend this game. I wanted to put a lot of time to write a decent review. The combat is fun, the AI provide a decent challenge and move and react well. The game is stunning even on lower settings and seems to be very optimizable which is nice. On to the bad. The game crashes all the time. Devs show know sign of fixing any of these issues people are having. They allow this game to work with cheat engine so there are a slew of hackers in the darkzone at almot all times. There are plenty of graphical glitches including the ever so annoying walking along and you fall through the map glitch then you spawn in a safe house down and have to respawn again. The loading times are totally obnoxious even on a SSD. There is not much end game, they give you 3 dailys with poor rewards, and that leaves the dark zone which again is normally full of hacker ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s or people who camp extraction points or safe houses to player grief. Not to mention they nerfed the amount of pheonix credits you get from bosses which makes no sense whatsoever. I will wait for 1 more patch and a DLC and then I will most likely be dropping this game as will I am sure a lot of other people. This game has great potential but ubisoft and the devs seem hell bent on making it totally unenjoyable.

reviewText:
This game is like a huge chocolate bunny, it looks delicious but when you bite into it you realize that it is hollow.

There is no endgame content, once you get to 30/30 you are just chasing a number to later get to PVP level.

Only the same 4 PVE missions over and over, you have hard and challenging missions and they repeat daily.

There are only 4 mobs to kill, there is no diversity on the PVE system.

The crafting system is designed to make you slave weeks at a time to get enough parts to possibly" get a good roll on a weapon. All of the better gear REQUIRES a mat that can only be obtained in the darkzone. (PVP area).

The game is littered with Hackers and Glitchers because the majority of the game is client side. They ported it over from the x-box to the PC and didn't even think that it would need anti-cheat. They only recently implemented it in a hot fix 2 months out.

The "innovative feature" of being a "cover-based shooter" is more hindering than it is innovative due to the fact that you have to press another key to use the cover feature and that same key is also used to roll and dodge. so If you double tap the key next to a coverable area when you want to roll you end up jumping to that cover and vice-versa.

The "Endgame" that they say is totally optional is peppered with players that have glitched their way to the highest gear in the game within the first week of incursions release
date: so when you grind and struggle to get to PVP99
recommended:
you will constantly run in to players that are over geared and have a huge advantage over you during your confrontation.

The only thing positive about this game is the co-op feature. you can play 4 players in the same game in PVE and grinding from level 1 to 30 can be fullfilling but you can do that in 2-3 days and about a week for a casual player.

I regret spending $99.99 for this game and if I could go back and do it again

reviewText:
This game is one of the funnest game's i have played in close to a decade. It is fresh, new, and fairly unique gameplay. It has some of the best PvP in any RPG out there, skill, using whats around you, knowing when to pop CC at the right time, knowing when to fight and when to flight. It leaves INCREDIBLE room to outplay your opponent.

Numbers in a fight are also not that huge of a factor, a group of 4 can beat a group of 20 if played correctly (trust me, i've done it)

So now youre probably wondering why i am giving this a negative review if i find it that fun. Well its because unfortunately the game riddled head to toe with people using third party cheats. The game primarily runs client side (meaning stats, hit registration etc is all handled on the side of the players computer instead of the game's server).

This allows for incredibly easy exploitation of the game, as a result 9/10 pvp fights you get into in the darkzone will have atleast 1 person using cheats and 1 shotting people from 100 yards away with an SMG. Whats worse is that Ubisoft is choosing to focus on fixing exploits on the PVE side of things (like a boss glitching out and being able to kill it over and over for loot) as opposed to focusing on the darkzone (PvP) which is the ONLY reason the game is as fun as it is.

It's been 2 months and still nothing has been done to fix the issue aside from 3-14 day bans for those caught, only those bans can be removed by simply changing your Uplay user name, thats how ♥♥♥♥ing horrible their security is when it comes to cheating.

I cant recommend this game, it completely ruins it and Ubisoft doesnt seem to give a ♥♥♥♥. If you absolutely HAVE TO HAVE the game, buy it on the console. Thats coming from a PC Master Race nazi too, thats how bad it really is.

May The Division rest in peace

reviewText:
So finally after 6 hours of gameplay im ready to spread a word about this game...

I can say about how this game is beautiful n stuff but thats not a point. Its new release so we can all expect high end effects. Engine looks amazing, you can see in water not random textures but really what is at the water reflects.

Alright lets get to the point of this review.
Game feels really empty, even if there are some random walking and shouting pedestians game still feels empty. AI isnt that good but the point of it is to coop with other players and have very srong enemies to kill. Understandable...

Game have lots of bugs, at the very start i couldnt acquire mission from laptop, at the other hand game crashes constantly throwing me to my desktop. Sometimes enemies body glitch on the floor making them flying around the spot they died.

Disconect from the server ocassionally sounds really bad for AAA release. Loading the mission and loading screen stuck at 36%... games freeze and crash to the desktop. Constanly when staring new mission coop after joining the division game just freezes and cant do anything apart for restarting the app.

Audio is really solid, graphics looks awesome, everything runs smooth but its not paying off that feeling its just a game.
Title with potential but its not used properly. Probably with a time there will be DLC's filling out the whole game world.
My point of view about this game is that title isnt finished. You can clearly see there is a lot of things to be polished and its done in rush.

Strong 7 out of 10 for lack of random events, lonely feeling when playing this game where i need to admit beta gave me that feeling of emotions. There isnt anything to keep you playing, so far its ok but i know i will lost intrest of the game because all side missions and materials farming missions are all the same.

If could refund the game now i would do it. Game is good but its not lifes changing title. Can i recommend this game? I will say YES if you are looking for some great effects and overall good looking game. If you was waiting for great title where everything is about great gameplay youll be dissapointed and i cant recommend this game.

Kind regards,
d5

reviewText:
Honestly this game isn't worth the $59.99 which I bought the gold for $99.99 I refunded it today. Here are my reasons why.

Dumb AI (Literally there was a point when the enemies just stood in front of me and not do a damn thing)

Bugs and quite a bit of them (This includes in game with not giving us gold and pre order content to black screens, as well as disconnecting issues)

The gameplay reminds me a lot of Destiny but with a new settings and the fact its in third person so different mechanics (It feels stale I only played for two hours and I started to get bored after getting to Manhatten. Its literally point A to Point B with the same dumb AI with a slightly tough boss here and there)

Online is alright but it gets old. (Didn't get to play to much online but I mean from what I've played its nothing to return to)

Graphics were definitely downgraded and I don't care how much Ubi denies it.. It was because of consoles and they INFACT did downgrade this game to keep all platforms on par. (I know this isn't a big deal but it still cant be ignored either)

Honestly I will buy this game again when it goes on sale within the next year. I would not spend over $39.99 for this game. I requested a refund so now I will spend my money on something a bit better. This is my opinion everyone is entitled to there own. :)

reviewText: So many Hackers
voteText: 8 of 8 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Pros:

-Lured into the game based on a great story concept (it's good while it lasts!). Left wanting because 5% of the game is actual story.
-Down right beautiful game. The detail is incredible.
-Had a blast leveling 1-30.
-Fairly large map.
-Co-op in 100% of the game.

Cons:

-There's enough glitches in this game to confuse people into thinking they're playing a game in beta. The beauty is that I don't have to even give an example. Play the game and it won't take long to find one.
-The game effectively ends once you hit lvl 30. After that it's just a pursuit for better gear which for me is a waste of time. Ubisoft could easily have expanded on the story past lvl 30 and built more of a unique character. Instead they took a very lazy route and said....story?...No, your story progresses and your character develops solely based on gear stats. Booooooriiiiiiiiiing.
-Hackers. Actually the first game I've ever had a problem with this. I've come across them before in ther games (sure!), but in the Division you just expect to run into a hacker. This problem expands as well. See, past lvl 30 the dark zone is really the only area to play in minus Incursion. If the only area left is over run with hackers what are you suppose to do in this game? Login to fulfill some daily generic quota. That's called a chore.
-Tying in with the last point. They have at least 75% of the map they designed useless past lvl 30. Why waste all of that? Do something with it!
-Weapon system is broken. Everyone uses the submachine gun or assault rifle exclusively. Shotgun? LMG? Show me a person that rocks a shotgun at high levels and I'll show you The Division glitch free.

I think what the future brings to this game will be a good thing. I'm definitely not giving up on it despite the cons I listed. I really do hope that the problems everyone is complaining about will not fall on deaf ears. Looking at the future content they've posted also seems like a good time. Hackers gone, glitches fixed, usable map equals a very high recommendation.
voteText: 8 of 8 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game has been a roller coater of letdowns. The map is tiny, the multiplayer is glitched, the npcs could not be more annoying, and the campaign has as much content as the single player mode of any call of duty game. This combined with the fact that most of the content is going to be sold in a series of micro expansions over the next year and the new 2 strike policy of using exploits that ubsioft has no intention of fixing anytime soon compel me to write this review.

tl;dr just wait till this goes on steam sale for 20$ in a few months.

reviewText:
I'm writing this review because I have officially given up.  Prior to the Incursion patch, this game already had many flaws, but it was legit fun.

Pros:
- Visually a beautiful game
- Characters and items look amazing
- Cosmetic items look great

Cons:
- Infinite amount of glitches (more and more found each day)
- Glitches are patched at a very slow rate
- Developers seem to only patch the easily fixed ones
- Population of hackers is overwhelming (there is no easy way for users to report hackers)
- Game breaking glitches (infinite bullet dmg, teleporting, etc) have been around for a while but still not patched
- New loot system has made it even harder for new and casual players to obtain competitive gear

reviewText: HOLY BUGS AND SPAM, BATMAN. This game is a single player game. Between getting ♥♥♥♥♥ in the Dark Zone by hackers, to getting randomly teleported to a random spot joining a group, this game's endgame sucks. Want a chat window? Good luck. Oh , not to m,ention the daily quests to get your end game items rarely reset like they are supposed to. Too many bugs. reviewText:
I really am not sure on this one.
The game /was/ fun, sure. I /had/ a lot of fun with my friends playing The Division, but now I don't even load it except once or twice, then realise nobody is online and quit instantly. But there are a lot of key problems to the division:

1) The amount of bugs/glitches. This game was developed by a very large game corporation and they release with a plethora of bugs and issues. Come ON!

2) The game gets boring and repetitive easily. These new feature don't save that. Missions are all the same, exceptions being the incursions which are fun but not worth doing multiple times

3) NOT a single player or small group game. You have to be in a group of 4 to do any form of event or activity else you'll get ♥♥♥♥ on by other players

4) The weapons are not balanced, the skills are not balanced, the armour bonuses are not balanced. Things like 1 hit kill sticky bombs or when you hit someone with a full clip of 200k DPS and only a micrometer of their health bar changes. It's a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t game at times, and when I say at times I mean about every 10 minutes in the DZ.

Although there's a lot of negativity, we do have to give credit where credit is due.

1) The game is visually stunning.

2) There are brilliant teamwork possibilities.

3) Multiple abilities can pitch in; you don't have to be just one type player, you can mix and match your skills and abilitites.

Overall, however, the cons outweigh the pros and I would give this game a 4.5 Grind out of 10. Would not grind again unless serious improvements to the game are made within the forseeable future.

reviewText: hurr durr they knew EXACTLY how many people bought this game and walked into a bad launch on purpose another dissapointment by ubisoft, DO NOT buy
voteText: 164 of 299 people (55%) found this review helpful 14 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Final update / Edit:

I've given up on the game. Maybe I will try again in a few years, who knows. I've already lost faith in Ubisoft before this game hit the shelves. Although, I had a small glimmer of hope for The Division before, even that, was crushed by Ubisofts lackadaisical and neglectful attitude toward The Division's players, not to mention a disgruntal worker releasing the sourcecode for the game, making any cheat possible.
(Ubisoft has a lot of disgruntal workers, I wonder why...)

Of the many problems:

- Glitches and abuse of glitches in PvP and PvE that strait up break the game

- Script Kid galore. Any cheat you can think of is being done in The Division

- Bugs are not being fixed fast enough. What do they have, one guy left to fix all of The Division's errors? Poor guy, no wonder they are disgruntled.

- End Game Content is being rushed

- Loot system was margininal, until they strait up broke it

- Crafting system was meh, until they strait up broke it

- Ubisoft banned a cheater who warped to noob areas and one shot people for... wait for it... 3 WHOLE DAYS (but only after a verbal warning to stop cheating).


Don't believe me? Just look on youtube. Or follow this link:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DieOaMGiHF8

I don't blame all of the Devs, I don't think the game is inherently bad (It could be quite fun actually). It's just the way Ubisoft in general handles their products and the lack of respect they give to their consumers and the gamming community that has me thoroughly disgusted with them. I'm done with Ubisoft.

reviewText:
2/5*

Well I'm really glad I got my refund. Considering just logging into the game and having an extra 3gb patch to download on launch day added to my time played at least an hour and a half. The last hour I spent playing a game that felt fun and exciting at times with the size of the map and easy to pick up combat.

I found myself being shot at some point by invisible enemies. Multiple times killed in the Darkzone and regular campaign by enemies that hadn't loaded on my screen but were able to kill me over and over. Not to mention areas where my friends could walk through freely but I'd be blocked off by an invisible wall. My system surpasses the recommended settings and I even set everything to the lowest possible settings graphically. Still certain areas of the city would remain blacked out not like it was apart of the dynamic lighting but like certain levels weren't loading correctly... this was usually followed by being killed by an invisible NPC/player.

I haven't even made it past level five and I can't even finish one side mission. I would have really liked to sink my teeth into this game but with how it looks right now I'm just glad to have a refund. I may try it again when it goes free to play.

reviewText:
There was a lot of potential for this game. I forked out a good hundred bucks for it because I really enjoyed the beta, with only a few days til release I figured it would be safe to bet most of that beta was accurate. Boy was I wrong as hell. I personally have a strong distaste for anything with the Tom Clancy title slapped on it as there is usually a lot of gameplay elements that I hate in them. When I played the beta everything seemed to my liking, but when I actually played the final release I started to see that clancy after taste that I despise so much. So many bad gameplay elements that in theory would be good. In the end I ended up getting a refund, I really wanted to like this game.

PROS: decent graphics, an okay story, lots of weapons, at face value decent gameplay.
CONS: rather unintuitive controls, horrid AI, lack of character creation tools, repetative missions.

Personal Note: I encountered this strange bug" where my cover would become hollow and bullets would pass right through hitting and killing me."

reviewText:
Dewderson's Review is no longer available.

Error Code Mike 02220500 Sierra 26074050 Delta 60775000

The Division services are unavailable at this time.

Uplay services are offline at this time.

EDIT- Now that the game is no longer Tom Clancy's The Disconnection let me give you a brief honest review of the game.

This game, in itself, is built on grinding and looting. That is the early, mid, and endgame of The Division. If you have no one to party up with, you will NOT have fun. The atmosphere will keep you drawn in until right about level twelve or so even if you are by yourself. Then the repetitious nature of the game will become more and more noticeable. All of the story missions are more or less the same with small progressive story elements.

Search and destroy or capture and hold, followed by a boss fight half the time, the bosses are typically slow moving tanks or gadgety tanks or a combination of both at once. The bullet sponge mechanics of the game are mixed, some firefights are fluid and realistic feeling. Others reminds you that the game is an RPG and you pour bullets into elite/armored/boss enemies for upwards of ten minutes.

The Dark Zone

It is, in itself, fundamentally flawed. There is little to no incentive to go Rogue and the fact that self defense causes an increase in your timer places you in firefights where you are outnumbered at least two to one. So then who goes rogue? Twinks. No I'm not talking about gay porn. The only rogue players I've seen have been players at max levels of their brackets with the best equipment the Darkzone can give them. They go around in teams of two to four players and butcher lower levels.

How do they manage that if it's at least two to one?" Rogue status is triggered by a certain amount of damage
date: so two rogue players can coordinate to kill off two members of a four man team so they now have an almost even; stand up fight. Or more commonly
recommended: they just come up behind PVE players and shoot them in the back and take their stuff. You lose your gear
hoursPlayed: and likely miss your window to recover it as your murderers timer's will have ended before you make it to them. You will also get killed by the same players who go back to "Non Hostile" status after their timer ends. Self defense for both Rogue and Non-Rogue players warrants punishment
voteText: trying to recover your things after the timer ends makes you Rogue
helpfulPercent:
shooting people you know will go Rogue and kill you makes you Rogue. Which brings me to the final flaw.

Blue Blocking

Blue blocking happens on this game enough for people to notice
votesHelpful: but not enough for everyone to talk or complain about it a lot. Blue blocking is stepping in front of someone who is fighting Red players or NPCs and making them Rogue
votesTotal: how many times have I seen it? Seven for about ten hours in the Dark Zone. Its typically people blocking your line of fire with jumping jacks while you're trying to kill a rogue player. It is
votesFunny: very
commentsCount: very annoying.\n\nWhy did I elaborate on the Dark Zone more than anything else? Because that is the most interesting part of the game
column16: grind
column17: grind
column18: grind
column19:
through the story so you can grind some more. This isn't necessarily a bad game. But it's definitely not a game I recommend to most people. If you like grindy games then you won't be disappointed when you get this game.

PROS
+ Atmosphere
+ Setting
+ Factions/Characters
+ Customization
+ Crafting/Weapon Modding
+ Map Size
+ Visuals

CONS
- Grindfest
- Repetitive missions
- Rogue system is broken
- Dark Zone is just grinding and griefing
- Sparse story doesn't make you very involved/Mute character

7/10"

reviewText:
Like many others:

I really enjoyed the single player/co-op story and gameplay.  This game reminds me a lot of Freedom Fighters by Edios, which was a single player game that I really enjoyed.  And the game is beautiful.

And then I got to the level 30 Dark Zone PvP gear grind.  How the hell do you make an online PvP game component without planning for cheaters?  That's rediculous.

Even if Massive can do something to stop the cheating, it's too little too late.  They've already shot themselves in the foot with this one.

reviewText:
Hey Guys!

After waking up from sleeping more then 4 hours for the first time in the past 5 days with a accumulated playtime of 3 days and 6 hours i thought it would be time to take a look on the good and bad of this.

positive:

-addicting af
-the grinding 3rd person shooter i expected it to be
-quick patching (if good or not, atleast it shows the devs care)
-the look of this game is incredible
-customizing options are really good
-story was cool, nothing epic, but pretty cool
-level of detail for background is crazy!
-map is big and perfectly layed-out for DLC's
-skill system gives a wide room for different builds
-many weapons with even more customizable perks and talents
-athmosphere is great, especially in snow storms


now to some of the things, that i think they are gonna patch anyway, but it gotta be mentioned.

negative:

-rogue system in the darkzone is a bit broke and makes pvp not even considerable, if you want to level seriously in dz
-endgame content for heavy grinders like me is a bit thin, hoping for the april update here
-cover system doesnt feel native on PC
-the gear available should be prized in a different way, as people outgear the vendors and therefore sit on ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s of ingame currency
-i wanna give dogs food too.

i think, thats about it.

do i recommend to stop whining about a game after the first week of release? yes.

do i recommend this game if you like grindheavy games? oh **** yeah!

do i recommend this game to pvp players? not in the current state


i had so much fun with this game and still have, i hope the content drops are good, because then this game could really become a new standard for mmo's.

cheers

reviewText:
I would recommend not getting this game unless you have friends to play with (to add slight fun to your play). The game is very bland in gameplay and in my opinion it's basically just rinse and repeat. For example, the dark zone is the same as the beta, it gets very boring. You literally run around looking for loot and racking up currency to buy gear that changes every so often. I have noticed that there is basically no end game, it's just farming the same weapon or armour.

However, mission levels are well designed, the design of the level is always in high detail and has a lot of places to explore. I wish they added more things that you can actually searc and loot.

The AI is poor, they sponge a lot and act very stupid, they literally just run into you and deal immense amount of damage; this can be very frustrating over time. The load times as well are very long, depending on your PC build.

I have noticed the weapons on this game are usually just alterations, i.e. The SCAR. The SCAR has two variations, automatic model and single shot model. Same thing sort of applies to character clothing, I wish they added various different types of backpacks, they all look the same.

Don't get me started on character customization, probably the worse creation system I have ever come across, it is all just presets. You cannot change any of the facial features, i.e. eye brow type or eye colour.

The only good thing that I found with this game is the atmosphere and world design, even though the game went through a downgrade since E3 2013. I played only 2 hours, but I can see this game will fail over time and its direction is not aimed at me at all.

The game was a huge let down to me, but I kind of knew this was going to be the outcome as it is Ubisoft.

reviewText:
Ubisoft told us the definition of insanity on far cry 3, now they gone and showed us this game as an example.
NO mission distinctions, side missions are ALL the same, main missions and historyline are basically forgetable (and sometimes the same as side mission, but a bit longer), seems like you're just doing the same thing over and over and OVER AGAIN. The PVP, which was the main focus of this game? Broken. Completely unbalanced, totally not worth going rogue, the punishment you get for pvp is crushing.  IF you want some lore on what happened, or anything story based, just go pick up collectibles, and even if you do that, you'll just feel like you've missed the whole thing and arrived late to the party. Now, the MMORPG aspect is kinda of acceptable, except for the annoying daily missions grind, or DZ lvl 32 bosses grind. But you know, these unbalanced things will settle with time, but the history? That won't. Maybe if you bought a season pass they could make a DLC where you play the first wave? Maybe. But for as the date of this review, game is totally not worth the money i threw at it.

EDIT: I forgot to mention the amount of glitches and bugs despite the 2 betas. Don't believe me? Take it to the forums, i've found a ton of them myself while playing.

reviewText:
Waited 40 minutes for the game to install, then waited another half an hour to get the game to work and I still can't play it. This is a ♥♥♥♥ing disgrace and if it's not by fixed tomorrow morning I'll be getting a refund and I'm NEVER in my life buying another Ubisoft product.

Edit: After seven hours of errors, bugs and crashes, the game seems to be working fine now for most people, myself included. With that said, the performance is still highly inconsistent and the character creation is a JOKE. The Nvidia game-ready driver does nothing to improve the performance and judging by the visuals (which have definitely been downgraded btw) the game should be running a lot better. So far, I'm not impressed.

Edit 2: The launch for this game was awful, and the performance is still not ideal but I finally can say that, as of right now, the game is working like it was supposed to from the start. I wish there was a neutral rating I could give to this game, because it's definitely not for everyone. I can see and understand why someone would be cynical and judgemental towards this game. It's one big grindfest, the enemies all look the same, the story is nothing special and the visuals received a significant downgrade, although it's nothing quite as striking as the Watch Dogs and Dark Souls 2 downgrades. With that said, I'm still really enjoying this game, and I can only see it getting better as it goes on. I wasn't mislead in any way and I knew what I was getting myself into. It's a somewhat generic third person shooter with RPG elements, but one that knows how to keep its hooks in you when it needs to. It's a mix between Destiny, The Last of Us and Ghost Recon but with a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ campaign. If that's what you are looking for in a game, then you might as well give this one a try. But if you're like me and you're sick and tired of the way Ubisoft's been treating PC Gamers, then vote with your wallets and stop supporting the company alltogether.

reviewText: Very terrible experience. Absolutely unplayable for half a day after it came out because of the traditionally terrible Ubisoft servers. When you finally get in the game, bugs are all over the place, and only around 1/12th of Manhattan is actually playable (and it doesn't appear as if you can physically go anywhere else). The application crashes when you try to invite friends to play with you (multiple times). Other times just launching the app fails completely and leads to music on a black screen with CTRL-ALT-DEL and ALT-F4 doing nothing whatsoever making it completely unplayable. Missions are unstartable for no reason. You get one-shot doing the initial, base-level missions. The beta was so much better then this. I should have expected this after what they did to Rainbow Six: Seige

reviewText:
I have to start by saying that I really did enjoy, I like the game's story and I thought that the missions itself were fun...

The end game content and the PvP is what is the bane of the game and has essentially made this game broken. What is worse is that every time the end game and PvP gets adjusted it get even worse.

I have many issues with the game and one of them being the crafting system for level 30 gear.  When the game first came out the number of lower end material need to make one higher end material was the following; 5 green to make 1 blue and 5 blue to make 1 yellow.  After the incursion patch and is still 10 green to make 1 blue and 15 blue to make 1 yellow.   You probably thinking that this change does not sound so bad and it would have been fair if Ubisoft had adjusted the rate at which you get material, but no Ubisoft made it worse.  Each material point on the map now only gave 2-3 items per box at a refresh rate of 4 hours per box.  This was changed from the 2-3 items per box at a refresh rate of 1 hour per box.  Also the weapon breakdown went from 2-3 material per item broken down to 1 material per item broken down.  This change had two effects, one it made crafting into a grind and a joke as all the stats on an item you craft are random and you can only readjust a single stat.  You’re probably thinking big deal why don’t you just make another item to reroll the stats, that a great idea if Ubisoft hadn’t jacked up all the prices for crafting.  What cost 3 weapon material 5 electronic material now cost 8 weapon material and 6 electronic materials.  The second effect is that it screws over legitimate players mostly.  The cheater/hacker/exploiters don't need to craft anything, they just run the incursion on hard or run around screwing legitimate players in the dark zone.  The cheater/hacker/exploiters are the ones running around with the best gear and killing people at random because they think it is fun.

Another issue is the vendors.  90% of the time the vendors just sell the same stuff over and over again and they don’t rotate the blueprints.  Which means you can get 2 items from the new armor sets then you have to play the incursion or the challenge mission and prey that you get the piece of armor that you want.  That would not be as much of an issue, if there were more ways than playing the bullet sponge filled challenge and incursion mission.

Another major issue is the PvP, dark zone.  When the game launched it was really costly to go rouge and a lot of people we just cooperating for the most part.  Now all the penalties for going rouge have been nurfed and you’re more likely going to get killed by some random hacker who is running around killing people for kicks because he/she is already maxed gear and does not need to go around and kill you to steel your gear.  Ubisoft should have had multiple dark zones like they had shown when they announced this game a few years ago at E3.  Different dark zones with varying penalties for encouraging people to be cooperative or not; This would have solved for the most part, the need to adjust the dark zone over and over again.  I for one would have like to have multiple dark zones and have all the different bonuses/penalties for going rouge/ cooperative play.

*As of right now after the April 29th Ban Hammer" drop
date: the dark zone as it stands rewards players for being an a**.  A PvP zone in which to get the gear you have earned to your inventory you have to call a supply drop.  That mechanic is fine
recommended: but what isn't is that there are now groups of people just camping drop zones to kill anyone not in their group trying to extract dark zone gear.  I have been gaming a very long time and I think this is the first PvP game where I have been actively punished for not being an assh*** in the game.  Also why am I getting killed by people with a dark zone rank of 99
hoursPlayed: my question is why are they in the same dark zone as me
voteText: why did Ubisoft not separate people by dark zone rank and gear level and lastly how in the world did you get to dark zone 99 last month with all the rapid hackers in the dark zone without cheating.  All these problem for the most part would have been fix if they had multiple dark zones.  Also to that end why is it that the people who kill you and steal your stuff don't show up on a play log.  The way it is now you can't really review your actions and you can forget about even look up the people that screw you over.  Even if it is to see if they were legit screwing you over or using ill-gotten gains to screw you over.  If Ubisoft wanted me to tell them if someone is cheating

Every enemy now has the HP of a challenge mission boss and can do damage that is comparable to the average level 30 player but the enemy now have an accuracy rating of 100% stacked with a stability rating of 100%.\n\nThere are many more glaring issues

reviewText:
Graphics: beautiful. Some amazing little touches and attentions to detail.

Roaming around a beautifully reconstructed post-disaster New York, working your way with your friends to level 30: a whole lot of fun.

Post level 30 endgame: barely existent. Terrible. Hideous. Broken. Pointless.

If I'd written this review during the romp to level 30 I'd have given it a solid 8-9 out of 10 and a big thumbs up. However, once you see the utter lack of enjoyable content after all the story missions are done with, playing this game just becomes a chore.

Rather than the intended interesting, tense PvP experience, the Dark Zone has just become a nest for hackers and griefers. There's no anti-cheat system so groups of teleporting scum will one-shot you for fun, and there's nothing you can do about it. The only thing to do in the DZ anyway is run around farming crafting materials, which is unbelievably boring in the first place. But the fact that you're basically unable to even do that due to said hackers and griefers... yeah. The endgame is a broken mess.

It might be worth trying in 6 months or so once they fix the biggest bugs, do something about the hacking, tweak the balance so other loadouts besides the same SMG/sniper are viable, and add more endgame content that isn't utterly repetitive. But a lot of these issues involve making huge changes to the underlying game, so who knows if they'll ever get fixed.

I was looking forward to this game for more than 3 years, but as fun as those first 10 or so hours were, this game is simply not worth buying at this price. I regret getting the season pass. In the end, the most satisfying experience I've had with The Division since hitting level 30 was clicking the uninstall button and playing something else.
voteText: 8 of 9 people (89%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
I want to first say, I loved this game. I bought the season pass, being totally on board the hype train. It was an amazing experience throughout, beautifully crafted environments with so much small detail I could get lost in them for hours just looking around. The story was mostly engaging, with most of the lore burried in the environments and collectibles. Those were surprisingly fun to find and taught you a lot about what happened during the events before the second wave. The DZ was fantastic, the loot drops weren't the best items you could get, but grabbing them for crafting materials was totally worth it. Crafting was great, and I made several very cool weapons that carried me through the majority of the late-ish game.

But then hackers. I mean a LOT of hackers. Practically every DZ I went into had someone, sometimes groups of them, teleporting around and instakilling every other player they found, regardless of whether they had gear or not. The few times I got into a DZ with no hackers I reallt enjoyed myself, running around killing enemies, finding other players, going rogue once in a while to spice it up and get my adrenaline pumping.

Then the Incursion update. This brought with it the crafting nerf, and also buff of DZ and challenge mode missions. I picked up so many HE's I didn't even know what to do with them all. But the majority of them were garbage. So they became crafting mats, that I couldn't get enough of because of the crafting nerf.

I tried the Incursion. It was some of the worst gameplay I've ever experienced as an end game" activity in any video game. 15 waves of enemies? That would be fine if there were any save points. But there weren't. You died on wave 14? Do it all again
date: if you were lucky enough to make it that far through all the one shot mechanics that is. Shotgunners that can't be stunned and random tank shots from the APC drove every player into a little hole in the middle of the map to slowly pick off enemies and not get murdered every 5 seconds. Sitting in a little hole picking off enemies is boring. And thats all it was. For 15 waves. I never finished it and just gave up because it wasn't worth 2 hours of boring gameplay for one piece of gear that may or may not be an upgrade. Whoever thought of that as a good idea for an end game scenario should seriously rethink their definition of "fun".\n\nThen came the exploiters. Breaking the game to get the best gear possible
recommended: and then taking it into the DZ to be invincible against any other player. They were just as bad as the hackers and script kiddies before them. As if the DZ wasn't broken enough with hackers killing everyone
hoursPlayed: instead it was someone that had exploited the incursion to get full gear sets and the best guns killing you and calling you a scrub for not doing the same.\n\nI want this game to be good. I want it to be everything they promised and more. It seriously had a chance at being my all time favorite game with the amount of fun I had in the first month of playing. Instead it has fallen apart

reviewText:
Originally excited for the premise of this game. Decided to give Ubisoft the benefit of the doubt....again. Regret it......again.

I will say there is something about the game that kept me coming back a few times to play just a couple hours. However if I had to go back and buy it again I would pass.

Released on Steam but you still have to go through Ubisoft's terrible terrible Uplay client.
Customization is beyond usless, change the color of your jacket and choose from 3 faces basically.
Pretty pathetic gun selection, considering the premise of the Division is basically an unorganized unit
Repetitive side missions
Repetitive enemies, either the gang members or the pyros from TF2
Boss fights are just bullet sponges that constantly walk towards you to push you out of cover
Loot system is so random in all my playing I've gotten 1 purple drop
Dark Zone is full of hackers that kill you on sight despite if you have loot or not
Servers are constantly down with no warning
Just not enough content to keep you interested for long
It's like Borderlands minus the everything

reviewText:
This game has a great leveling experience with a few cool missions here and there. The fact that the base game is soo good and that the devs don't seem to care about the game ever since they got their money from hyping up the release of the game just indicates it's not worth it to play.

The endgame is full of cheaters with no way to permanently ban them. There are also glitches for basically all the high end enemies and encounters, cheesing them for the best items in the game. There is no reason to get good gear either, as the hackers could run around with a grey pistol and it would still feel like being shot by a minigun.

Basically, a good game with a not so good dev team.

reviewText:
The game was fun. It was fun completing the missions. Teaming up with people to finish tasks.  Complete the seperate wings.  Get the place run.  It was fun with the incursions, challenging as they are, especially with the new Falcon Lost.  But then the DZ was always the place to pick up the higher end gear.

And thus griefing and roguing became to do in this game.

This game rewards those who like to be the bad guys. To grief players. To farm farmers.  To screw other players over.

Because after you complete the missions and run the side quests and even do the new added daily missions and HVT, we all know the best gear is in the DZ, and yet the only way to get it is by either extraction or roguing and steal from others.

To those who are below 200, it is probably much more enjoyable before you get to the upper brackets, where its all rogues all day long  and all night long.

I get it. This is the set up.  I don't think there's any real way to fix this unless there's an arena within the DZ just for PVP.  But that's just not going to happen.

So when you are in the middle of a 4 sided NPC battle with your group of 4 players with high gear, you can get hosed by another pack of 4 rogues who will gank you and your crew, take away your stuff and talk crap about how much you suck and that they love roguing.

In the meanwhile, you lose gear, dz xp, dz credit, and all that time you wasted.

No wonder the number of players have dropped.  Who wants to play with these kind of players.
