reviewText:
I have a lot of mixed feelings about this game. On one hand, I love pretty much anything with RPG elements tied into it, and what the devs themselves were going for (emphasis on going for, because they sure weren't very successful in it) is exactly the kind of game I'm looking for. Plus, just about everyone likes a game with guns. Lots of guns. And explosions. Pew pew.

On the other hand, though... The creators have done just about everything WRONG in the RPG aspect of the game. Not to mention the fact that... well, Ubisoft. Enough said. And just in case not enough is said; bugs/glitches/exploitations everywhere, most of which will undoubtedly never be fixed. This, combined with Ubisoft's modern-day lack of creativity and uniqueness across its games, and tendencies to water down gameplay with DLC and repetitive activities, rather than actual content, leaves a lot to be desired in the game. Bearing this in mind, can I, and will I ever be able to recommend the game to anyone, especially with Ubisoft outright lying and false advertising their products (check the Season Pass's reviews)? No, absolutely not.

Let's skip the part about actual bugs in the game, because Ubisoft is Ubisoft and the bugs themselves are already covered in plenty of other reviews. I want to concentrate on the actual game, and why I'm perhaps more enthusiastic in it than I should be, since it's the closest thing to what I'm looking for ever since the Borderlands series. The MMORPG aspect of this game could have been so much better than it actually is, and it feels completely rushed and not well thought out.

In terms of character creation, there are a maximum of 5 different selections in most visual/cosmetic appearance options, and each option is very, very generalized (for example, rather than being able to edit and make specific variations on facial structure, eyes, nose, jawline, etc. it's just a face" option

reviewText:
Good concept, bad execution.

The Good: Great storyline, cover system is phenominal.

The Bad: Bugs that greatly effect balance are on-going.

I surmise that they will lose quite a few players before reaching a steady state. Specific mechanics around damage mitigation and calculation prevent this release from being truly excellent.

My recommendation is to wait until it's on sale for $9.99 before trying it out. It was a fun run, but I'm going to put this one down for a while (>6 months).

reviewText:
This my friends... is how you sell a candy-coated, chocolate covered turd.

The marketing is done quite well with the videos and whatnot. Makes you feel like you might be a part of something big. Then you start playing and you feel exactly like none of that. Like that part just disappears and never existed. There is no immersion and the story makes you sleepy.

Breakdown of how I felt throughout the game:

Levels 1-14 you get that sweet, candy-coated shell.
Levels 15-29 there's an amazing, tasty layer of chocolate.
Level 30 you realize there's a turd in the center.

Endgame is just a giant grindfest to find better gear and gankfest at the extraction zones to try to extract it. You get killed by some douchecanoe with better gear than you, so you want to get better gear by doing the same !@#$ing thing. It's a vicious cycle. A grindy cycle. A boring cycle.


Thanks Ubisoft. You burned me for the last time.

reviewText:
(As of patch 1.0.2) --- This review is probably subject to change depending on updates to the game.

It's an okay game, an average game, it doesn't really innovate in any areas.
I am hesitant to reccomend to anyone, even though I've played a lot of hours and enjoyed them.
As far as a shooter goes, go for it. Fun for awhile. As far as a long term MMO goes, no.

Story falls flat and is forgettable, especially if you accidentally play it out of order because you group with higher level friends instead of being solo. For a story in a Tom Clancy game to be so lackluster it's just a little sad.

I enjoy the ramp up in AI, fighting the different factions is interesting, but soon enough you're level 30 and just fighting the same late game enemies all the time and it gets a little boring. You see all of them them again in the Dark Zone, but late game poor balancing makes DZ not all that much fun.

PvP is overly punishing and therefore on average, people don't really do it. And when they -do- do it, they always seem to be the people that are just super-geared and bored, so you stand no chance in defending yourself.

To get geared, you have to run the same challenge missions to the point where you'd like to just tear out your eyeballs in frustration. Running the same missions over and over. For example, I had to run a mission 6 times to buy 1 blueprint. Average runs for missions are like 15-30 minutes depending how geared and skilled your group is. If you run an average of about 20 minutes per run, that's 2 hours it took to buy one thing. Not counting the hours after that to farm materials to get a good crafting roll.

Alternative to get geared, spend hours in the Dark Zone attempting to kill NPCs for drops (no guarentee you'll actually find something) and hope you don't run into the overgeared players if you do. Basically no guarentee at all your hard spent hours will pay off. Fun for some people I guess, but when time is limited, you need to choose.
For me, I've been trying to get geared in missions and then trying my luck at DZ just for fun, knowing not much will come out of it anyway.

I think they need a dedicated PvP mode that rewards you for doing well at PvP and doesn't punish you for failing. DZ as it is currently is not scratching that itch. I'm not saying to change DZ, maybe it's fine and working as intended. But another battle arena area or something.

Cosmetics are limited and most of the ones you can find in game are super lackluster. People end up looking all the same and there's no way to tell a level 3 player from a level 30 player at a glance. There's a lot of potential for better stuff, but it's just not really there. Unless you buy the DLC packages that actually have the cool stuff. There isn't any camo clothing in the game... you have to buy the Marine DLC. Thankfully they gave us cool gun skins in game and didn't release them in a DLC instead. Usually cosmetics aren't that important but in a game like this where you are literally staring at your character all the time, it really is.

Guns feel good, I enjoy the different types available. I feel like I can't find a sniper rifle that beats out the performance power of an assault rifle though. Assault Rifles overall seem to cover all bases and using other weapons seems to hurt DPS too much. Shotguns are pretty fun though and LMGs seem good against NPCs when in a group for suppression power. SMGs are pretty good also if you're in range. Maybe it just comes down to preference and finding weapons with the right stats.

Getting new gear is fun. It's that Diablo high. Developing your character and tailoring your gear-build to your playstyle is fun. It's just a shame that getting the new epic loot has become more frustating than fun. Kind of like Diablo 3 at release.

There's a lot of bugs to iron out and it seems like when they patch they end up breaking more things in the process. I'm sure eventually they'll get all that sorted out, but in the meantime it's a bit frustrating. Definitely has been a turn off for a lot of people. Overall it's been a relatively smooth launch and when the game works it runs alright. There has been occassional times where the NPCs lag out and appear to hang up and crash, which can completely fubar your mission run... which feels like more time wasted considering how frustrating they can be. Maybe give it a month and see how much bugs they've ironed out.

Also loading times for traveling across map, etc. are stupid slow.

TL;DR  I like the game, I want to enjoy the game. But I think it might be awhile before the content catches up to make it that better game and I hope it's not dead in the water by then.

reviewText: first off let me say i like this game it is a lot of fun for the most part. people want to give this a bad wrap cuz they are unable to get over the disconnect of a realist setting and spongy enemies. its not that big of a deal. however if u r wanting to play this game cuz you think it will be a fun shooter...stop and save your money. its shooting mechs r passable. here is my problen with the game..... lvl 30 and lvl 30 braket DZ. so when you hit lvl 30 you now onl;y go into the dz with other 30's. doesnt sound bad right? well it is cuz since they nerfed the drop rate of high end items you are screwed. grinding for them is crap it takes way to long for a 100% random high end piece at the end of a pve mission that takes 30+ mins. crafting high end items deosnt happen till you are dz 50 good luck getting there. you will have ♥♥♥♥ gear and npc's will merc you if you are not in a group. rouges in high end gear wont even take much damage (let alone any) from you if you are not in all high end gear. i saw a rouge kill 3 other players and take a sliver of damage from them. its so broken in the end game. so broken! not to mention if you want to be a rouge player you will take it up the ♥♥♥. it is so punishing to go rouge. you lose so much money and dz xp its not worth it. the keys dont matter cuz thew chests dont srop anything worth while ever. if you want to be a bad ♥♥♥ rouge player here is my advise: 1) dont buy this game. (if you choose to any way) 2) dont go to lvl 30 stay at 29 (if u want to hit 30) 3) pve in the pvp zone and hope you can lvl up fast enough to get/make good gear.   i have 50+hrs in this and only have 1 high end piece. and i havent even hit dz 30 yet. so if u r rushing your lvls in this game dont play dz at lower lvls to make dz rank 30+. if you can hit dz 50 before you hit pve 30 then you are in like flin

reviewText:
When the game was announced, I was hopeful. When it was about to be released I noticed that there was an embargo on reviews, it wasn't a good sign so I held off. When the game launched there were many complaints but on recommendation from a friend who said it wasn't as negative as they said, just day one issues I purchased the game anyway.

So the good:

-Pretty good graphics and setting
-Groundwork for the plot and factions
-Instanced Multiplayer
-Large open world: Always something to explore and to collect.
-Base development

The bad:

-Uninteresting enemies: Three main enemy factions are mostly only distinct based on the clothes they wear. You have similar classes and each faction gets it's own twist on weapon capabilities but it boils down to Oh it's these guys again" and then mop the floor with them.
-Bugs and graphical glitches: Some of these ruin the experience quite a lot. In one case I kept falling through the ground and dying because my game had not loaded the world properly
date: and then dying again because I respawned where there was no world and fell through the map
recommended:
meanwhile my teamates couldn't rescue me.
-Weapon variation: There isn't much of it. You have basic weapon designs each with their own quirks and you get higher level weapons with more bonus' but they tend to be the same few designs. With the number of guns available in the US I would have thought I would have been using a wider variety than the same 3-4 assualt rifles.
-Large open world map: Always something to do and collect becomes a chore. Trying to get to the next mission or safehouse and then getting pulled into a side mission or collectable means that you spend far more time figuring out how to get to a roof than actually advancing the plot. So long in fact that you start to forget what you were doing in NY to begin with.
-Boring when you are playing by yourself. On your own the city is a cold and quiet place. You might spend 5 minutes running without anything happening. You don't run into anything interesting and the buildings are very reptitive. Apparently everyone in NY lives in the same type of building.
-AI civilians are incredibly dumb. You run past them on the way to help stop the arnachy and they accuse you of being one of them. Tell you not to point your gun at them when you didn't.
-Some game mechanics are overpowered. Supression for example

helpfulPercent: they just cower in fear.\n-Clothing customisation is essentially having the same 5 styles of coats in different colours. When you first get the option its nice but you have hordes of them by the end and no way of previewing it or sorting them.\n-Collectables more often than not

A quarintined island full of deadly disease? Where did they get such heavy ordinance?\n-And why out of all the enemies and friendlies you come across in the ENTIRE game that matter

reviewText:
Don't get me wrong, i actually love this game, but some things need to change and it takes weeks for a simple fix.

To this date, there has been no steps in the right direction to patch and punish hacks/hackers and glitches/glitchers. they did add anti-cheat and you get a 2 week ban, cmon? thats nothing. Should be first offence > ban. The NPC's are repetitive and dumb. and their heads stick out of cover all the time and that makes it too easy if you ask me, its meant to be a cover oriented game and they can't even get their NPC's programmed right. KEK

The darkzone is the biggest pile of ♥♥♥♥ as of right now 15/5/2016; with still some hackers and people abusing glitches to level up, npc's not respawning at times, and the 4 man teams that target 1 person when they are themselves. The darkzone is bland, and doesnt have enough content, going rogue is pointless and has no upside. that supply drop ♥♥♥♥ isnt worth even getting, purple gear is nothing after you have some high ends. the darkzone should be named; The Grief Zone.... PVP in DZ is awful, its killing its own playerbase 90000 > 10000 nice job devs!

I only have 170ish hours in this game, and i feel that it has so much potential but no, they devs are really stupid. They raise the amount of parts required to craft by almost 4x and it was hard enough already, the spam in chat with korean/chinese letters and people trying to sell incursion runs is cancerous. also; season pass bonus's are pointless too, its like 1/5 of materials needed to make a gun.

The graphics downgrade and optimization of this game is awful, the game looked too good to be true 2 years ago, and guess what, it was too good to be true. the snow looks like plastic EVEN ON ULTRA. the optimization in some areas is awful. but im willing to forget about that if there is good gameplay, but no.

As much as i like this game i will still play, but honestly, they didnt need to release this broken pile of ♥♥♥♥ this year. they could have made it so much better.

5/10

reviewText: You know, I've rarely, RARELY, give a game a negative review. This game is terrible, absolutely awful, first of all, the game keeps crashing on my end, and its not my PC. This game was NOT meant for PC, it is a bad console port with just minor configurations, same game, nothing new. Ubisoft needs to stop releasing broken games, the game stutters for 150 FPS, the game is repetitive. The plot is bad, its like a M Night Shymalan movie. Way to many loop holes and plot twists. The charcters are hardly recognizeble, and not memorable, there's shallow writing, and dialogue. Most will say the same lines, and their personality behavior turns a 180. It doesnt feel like you're saving Manhatten, and Day 1 release was bad too. The Dark Zone is REALLY BAD, it doesnt feel rewarding at all, going rouge seems pointless.  I have to say I am done with Ubisoft; I will remain faithful with the Assassins Creed series. Try as you might, but you will be disappointed with everything. This is not the E3 2013 version.\n\nTL;DR (The Division tanked.)

reviewText:
Game play (story mode): 5/10
Gam play (multi player, co-op): 2/10
Graphic: 9/10
Price to value ratio: Overcharged.
Feelings left to player after finishing the game: depression and / or anguish
Recommend this game? No.

-Game is so buggy for the price. Graphic is very nice but it is not so nice where there is a sink hole leading to the bottom of the map on the beautiful groun isn't it?

-Story mode is not very interesting. Seriouly, the trailer got me buying this game. I was happy in the first day playing it. I soon find out many missions are the same and it gets boring quickly. Replay value of this game is very low. Consider a $60 cost of this game? I say it's atoo expensive. The Co-op mode is ruinded by having the enemies level correspopnd to the highest level player in the team. Once you hit max character level, you have to depend on gear level, which is something you cannot work on easily and must depend on co-op or going into the dark zone. Which means either you have to suffer extremely tough enemies which cannot be killed and they can kill you quickly, or you have to suffer the evil deeds of other people. Either way, you will end up being more clyncial for the rest of the day, It's not very healthy. This is a seroiue catch 22 error the developers didn't think it throughly. For instance, you graduated from college but 80% of the jobs requires 5 years of experience. This is not right. We all know the reality is bad and we don't need this in a game, especially we paid $60 for it.

-Since the story mode is boring, repeatitive, one may assume the mulitplayer mode will make up for that...and the snwer is NO. They allow the worst side of humanity to ruin the game. We all know people like to do bad things to others if they are given the chance. UBI thinks it would be exciting to allow people to do what they want in the game and history tells us it usually leads to chaos and this game is no execption.

-Shows the worst side of humanity. I suggest you avoid purchasing it if you have something bad happened in your life lately. You don't want to get more negative energy from a stupid video game such as this one. I uninstalled it because something bad is happening to my friend and I wanted to releax a bit by playing this game and boy....was I wrong. I am even more depressed after playing 3 days in Dark Zone. I told myself....F**k that, that's it. If I spend 3 more days in there, I would probably, literally kill myself. I am not even trying to be funny, I am damn serious. Thank UBI. Thank you for making my life worse after I paid you $60 of my hard earnt money. I hope you developers can sleep well at night.
voteText: 7 of 8 people (88%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
In Division you play an Agent stranded in a future scenario where bugs have killed all the fun in technology and the community has fallen apart. You find yourself in a second wave of Agents, looking for traces of the many Agents from the first wave and time, that you've heared stories about but can't seem to find online anymore. The game never stops to amaze with new features in every update and patch, like suddenly being killed by a wild killer ladder, spontaneous disappearing daily missions, + and - minus signs on stats that do the exact opposite, falling through the map, random crashes in the last wave of incursion missions, a wide variety of discoverable exploits or bugs caused by bugfixes for bugs caused by bugfixes for bugs.

All in all, this now minimaley multiplayer online game offers you an unforgetable experience in many ways. It will redundantly stress your nerves just like in a real end-time setting, bring out the masochist in you while taking you on an emotional redundant rollercoaster ride and make you wonder if the developers of this game are drunk, monkeys, noobs or drunken monkey noobs.

Every time you play this game, you will always have something to talk about with your friends. Therefore buy the game! Experience it! Share your amazing experiences with your friends! Then forget the game and do something fun with your friends instead.

-Game is so buggy for the price. Graphic is very nice but it is not so nice where there is a sink hole leading to the bottom of the map on the beautiful groun isn't it?

-Story mode is not very interesting. Seriouly, the trailer got me buying this game. I was happy in the first day playing it. I soon find out many missions are the same and it gets boring quickly. Replay value of this game is very low. Consider a $60 cost of this game? I say it's atoo expensive. The Co-op mode is ruinded by having the enemies level correspopnd to the highest level player in the team. Once you hit max character level, you have to depend on gear level, which is something you cannot work on easily and must depend on co-op or going into the dark zone. Which means either you have to suffer extremely tough enemies which cannot be killed and they can kill you quickly, or you have to suffer the evil deeds of other people. Either way, you will end up being more clyncial for the rest of the day, It's not very healthy. This is a seroiue catch 22 error the developers didn't think it throughly. For instance, you graduated from college but 80% of the jobs requires 5 years of experience. This is not right. We all know the reality is bad and we don't need this in a game, especially we paid $60 for it.

-Since the story mode is boring, repeatitive, one may assume the mulitplayer mode will make up for that...and the snwer is NO. They allow the worst side of humanity to ruin the game. We all know people like to do bad things to others if they are given the chance. UBI thinks it would be exciting to allow people to do what they want in the game and history tells us it usually leads to chaos and this game is no execption.

-Shows the worst side of humanity. I suggest you avoid purchasing it if you have something bad happened in your life lately. You don't want to get more negative energy from a stupid video game such as this one. I uninstalled it because something bad is happening to my friend and I wanted to releax a bit by playing this game and boy....was I wrong. I am even more depressed after playing 3 days in Dark Zone. I told myself....F**k that, that's it. If I spend 3 more days in there, I would probably, literally kill myself. I am not even trying to be funny, I am damn serious. Thank UBI. Thank you for making my life worse after I paid you $60 of my hard earnt money. I hope you developers can sleep well at night.

reviewText: I was excited for this game.  I played the public beta, bought the game and season pass at full retail price, and have mostly enjoyed the game.  While playing the PvE early missions, I thought that this game was a perfect marriage of the cover system of Gears of War and the Third-Persion Shooter/RPG system of Mass Effect.  The PvE story is great and the challenge mode missions give a good sense of difficulty and accomplishment.  However, the PvP mode is so rage-quit-inducing that it alone is worth a thumbs down.  PvP is inundated with cheaters.  There have been instances of players teleporting out of combat, sniping through walls, infinite ammo cheating, and crit-accumulating (somehow unloading with a zillion point one-shot).  The bugs have been asinine (see the \Protection from Elites\" debacle).  If you like Tom Clancy style games/settings
date: the PvE is for you and you\'ll enjoy it for a single playthrough.  If you think this game will have the longevity of CS:GO or any of the CoD/BF series
recommended:
you'll be disappointed.

Pros Beautiful graphics
Great premise/story
Realistic NYC map and environment
Beautiful weather effectsCons No PvP-toggle (i.e. players can kill you before you know they're toggled PVP)
Crafting grind is soooooo bad
No anti-cheating detection (e.g. PVP cheaters in the Dark Zone teleporting and wall clipping)
End-game enemies have rediculous stats (e.g. enemies can absorb hundreds of headshots before going down while you go down with a "sniper shotgun" burst.)
The gear score calculations are rediculous (e.g. some of the lvl 192 well-rolled gear will demolish a poorly rolled lvl 240)"

reviewText:
I'm sitting there in level 1-14 Dark Zone, DZlvl 44 character with 13k HP and 30% armor reduction. Most level 14 characters can't kill me quick, not in a single magazine, far less in a second.

I've just gotten my best M1A to date, highest head-shot bonus and highest base damage out of all I've had so far. Standing right next to the gate in DZ02, a level 7 character shows up out of nowhere. Kills me in a fraction of a second, teleports directly on top of my dead body from 20-25 meters away. Grabs my loot and disappears.

I walk straight out of the gate seconds afterwards. No rogue anywhere on map.

This is far from the first time I've been killed by a hacker, but by a far the most obvious one so far.

You wanna know what the Dark Zone is really like, that's the short and long of it. Riddled with hackers.

reviewText:
I am on the fence, honestly. I currently do not recommend this purchase (excepting steam sales) due to a disastrous end-game, but the game leading up to it is polished and fun. Patches might repair the damage but until then beware.

* PROS: Great story, lots to explore, many side-quests until end-game. Crafting your base and early gear increments are exciting and addictive. Graphics are fantastic and you will make a lot of friends working missions and in general. Weapons and gear can be modded in many ways and can genuinely feel unique and handle very differently based on your choices.

* CONS: End-game is exceedingly repetitive and becomes a frustrating grind for often-times nearly useless crafted or enemy-dropped items. Crafting was recently made much more of a grind, basically tripling the required components, which exacerbates the repetitive grinding in the Dark Zone and in Challenging missions. Incursions are static and get old fast, strategy is the same every time and gear scores are already maxxed on many players (suspicious). ***Massive*** issues with players cheating, particularly in the dark zone using hacks to one-shot kill, teleport, and using shotguns and SMGs at very long ranges. Little or nothing done to combat this from a player perspective. Story missions and the immersive feel of the game end the moment you hit the level cap.

Understand that currently you are better off taking your time and enjoying the story and avoiding the end-game until the game has more to do and gets many fixes for the hackers. So-called challenging missions you can run by just following a solo by Chinese hacker firing guns that also shoot rockets and grenades and kill everything they hit in moments kind of takes the fun out of the missions. This game was a life-sink until the level cap. While I have high hopes much of this will be fixed, I currently hesitate to recommend the game in it's current state. There are few if any bugs, thankfully, but design problems and the ubiquitous cheating taking place in the barren and grind-heavy end-game is not worth playing.

I personally uninstalled the game and may come back in a few months if things are patched. Save your money for steam sales and keep an eye on the patch notes.

reviewText:
If there was a neutral recommendation option I would have selected that.

The short reason for this is the PvE/Coop experience is a ton of fun and superb. Add in the enviroment and atmosphere that Massive Entertainment spent years on perfecting and breathing life into and you have a stellar game whose only down fall is a lack of continuing content beyond the base game to keep the excitement up.

Sadly the PvP aspect quickly degraded from decently fun to unplayable. Originally what kept the PvP aspect from reaching its potential was the lack of actual PvP due to a small number of players spread out over a large area and also how punishing it was on players who initiated PvP (went rogue). Currently the Darkzone is home to hackers and if perchance you find an instance where there are no hackers you will sooner or later have one join in to ruin everyone's day. Add in the fact that the developers and publisher haven't taken aggressive, active action to resolve the hacker controlled Darkzone and instead opted for a passive, legitimate player driven cleanup of hackers and you get a feeling of being forgotten about by those you gave hard earned money to for a product they are not willing to actively support while also not listening to the playerbase when it comes to drastic gameplay changes that negatively affect the game.

All in all I have a small hope that the game will get better, but for now I recommend waiting until you hear more positive news about The Division and less headlines with the word 'hacker' or 'revamp crafting' in them.

reviewText: I have over 150 hours in the Alphas and Betas alone. I stopped playing the actual game after just 20 hours. It was litterally a total disappointment. There was nothing hyped that came out from when I played the Alphas and Betas. Not only that, the same problems occured. Crashes, terrible rendering, unbalanced scripts. Hell the Alpha and Closed Beta were actually more enjoyable than the games release itself. The issue with hackers hasn't even been touched on. That is a real shame because hackers appeared in the Open Beta and still haven't been fixed. In the Alpha and Closed Beta we didn't see any. Honestly this game should still be in the Alpha state. We were given what, 3 days to play it? Then not even a month later Closed Beta was released? Then 3 days to play again? Total joke. With a game that is supposed to be this hyped and some of us people waited years for its release, the companies involved with this title completely failed. I was hyped for this game since 2012 and I my hype for it died down the moment the game was released. Honestly everyone who bought this game should be refunded. And change the freaking price to $20 and put it as a Beta, cause seriously they need to fix so much in this game. This game was supposed to have an actual survival element, where you had to eat and drink. And the open world part wasn't supposed to be client side or only up to 4 members. It was supposed to be even bigger than what it is now. So many more things were supposed to be lootable. The looting aspect was actually supposed to mean something and not seem pointless. Why scrap more than half the ideas of what the majority of fans were hyped for? This is just another marketing stunt to get us hyped for another failure. Too many games that seem great, fall down because of their developers, publishers, and companies that are associated with the game title. Watch Dogs? ♥♥♥♥. DayZ? That went to ♥♥♥♥ too. Infestation Survivor Stories (WarZ)? ♥♥♥♥ also. The later COD Series? Even more ♥♥♥♥ (Honestly just play MW2, same ♥♥♥♥ passed that) Just don't buy this game, it isn't worth wasting your hours only to realize you can't refund it. Now some good games I will mention that are worth it. Rust (Still in Beta), The Fallout games (Fallout 3 and New Vegas being my favorites), The Elderscrolls (ESO isn't for a lot of people, wasn't what a lot of the fans expected), Rocket League, and many more. Most indie games are more successful and more enjoyed than over hyped ♥♥♥♥ like The Division. The saying It sounds too good to be true" usually is just an upright honest saying. In this instance

The rest of the games completely fine up to the point the only way you will get high end gear is threw luck, crafting or this ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t challange mode. ♥♥♥♥ that. You think its funny forcing people to kill themselves over how frustrating this ♥♥♥♥ gets. Master level players who had the chance to farm up 1000 credits before that ♥♥♥♥ing patch killed everones chance to get anything good. Before hand those players, the lucky limited few who spent that money on mods and gear for these modes. GG for them they can blow threw that ♥♥♥♥ easily with 15+ health regain on crit or kill an enemy = god mode for 2 seconds. etc. The ♥♥♥♥ing rest of us by nerfed, the drop rate and leaving no other choose for us. Guess what. Its ♥♥♥♥ing impossible. Full week of play in to the game. I do not recommend this still they fix the problem with challange mode. Games not worth it.

Now. For a more level headed point.

The game play up to the end game content, dark zone, hard mode and random incounters with enemy groups. They all seem to fit well and can be farmed for what little they give. The gun play is ok but a bit cluncky with reaction times. weapons dont fire right after being reloaded, some shot at the ground just after an animation and dont hit anything but the ground. Some small net code bugs like that. Worst I have seen has been people shooting a tank enemy in the face and showing no damage for over a minute before finally he ether killed everyone and was 16 feet behind them with a tiny bit of health left, or he dies instantly after still having a full bar of health.

The game needs some server restrictions. No one from china should have to put up with listening to a bunch of whiny 10 year old kids from the US, and No one should have to listen to a bunch of spanish kids screaming in the dark zone when you live in Canada. Point is. The Dark zone has no continental server support for those areas. Worst still is that you cant communicate with people that are doing missions who speak everything else but english. Personal problem for me maybe but how is it fair that they have to put up with me when I cant understand them and them asking me to do something? Its not is it.

After all is said and done I cant completely bad mouth the game till the dev's let out the DLC and hopefully bring patches to resolve this stuff. Till then the game sits a 2 out of 5 for me and I do not think anyone should bother trying to play this game up to end game levels.

reviewText:
This is one of those games where I wish Steam had a neutral option. Let's get the obvious out of the way. Yes, I've put a lot of hours into this game. Yes, I'm still actively playing it at the time of this writing. No, I do not recommend new people buy it at this point.

Pros: The game looks gorgeous with some of the best lighting and fire effects out there (note: I said *some* of the best, not *the* best). The sound design is on point and the gameplay itself is engaging which is why I'm still playing. It looks good, it plays good.

Cons: The game is content light and the developers don't seem to have a good grasp on how to handle this MMO/Shooter hybrid they've constructed. Once a player has finished the missions the game offers for leveling, that's it. The only content available after that is grinding in a PvPvE area known as the Dark Zone, playing the poorly constructed endgame raid" (it's not a raid in the traditional MMO sense
date: it's a single weakly put together horde encounter)
recommended: or replay a small selection of the missions the developers decided to bless with a replay option as opposed to offering an option to reset the world state. That's it on the content side of things.\n\nOne of the staples of successful MMO's as far as the end game is concerned is that there are multiple paths to getting endgame gear. While players will always find the "optimal" paths
hoursPlayed: the separate paths are generally kept on par with each other to support a variety of play styles. The Division doesn't do this *at all*. It shoehorns players into one method of playing by making other methods tedious and deliberately punitive. For players who enjoy crafting their gear in games
voteText: steer clear. The developers have made it abundantly clear that crafting shouldn't be an engaging activity a player actively
helpfulPercent: and intentionally
votesHelpful: seeks out in this title. The amount of materials required was already large
votesTotal: and a recent patch multiplied it by a factor of 15 through increasing material costs and decreasing materials gained from salvaging unneeded items. The currency needed to purchase recipes to craft the gear
votesFunny: once materials are collected
commentsCount: requires a grind of its own. As if two levels of the grind is somehow insufficient
column16: the player is barred from crafting precisely what they want
column17: as some other games allow
column18: in favor of a completely RNG based crafting system. So a player will collect the required materials for hours
column19: grind for hours to days for the recipes
column20: then craft an item that the RNG deems completely useless so the player has to amass fresh materials for more hours to try again...\n\nThis wouldn't be an issue if the gear dropped from enemies was worthwhile and actually made crafting something a player doesn't *need* to get the better gear
column21: but the drop system is lacking. For one
column22: the drop rate is absurdly low. The recent patch to guarantee "high end" drops from bosses is a bit of an odd duck. Yes
column23: the bosses drop "high end" gear
column24: and this change was advertised as removing the need for players to craft items. The problem? The "high end" drops from the majority of encounters in the game are a tier below the weakest "high end" items players can craft let alone the strongest stuff players can craft. Only a *very* small section of the game map offers drops on par with some crafted items. So to get the good stuff the players still generally have to invest in a crafting system that was intentionally setup to be punitive in a game that also has a problem with a lack of fresh and engaging end game content.\n\nShort version: If you're only interested in the game for the leveling experience form 1 to 30 (the current cap) this game might be worth it to you at full price. The game after level 30 is simply a grindy mess not fit for purchase without a steep discount. In its current state
column25: the endgame could serve as a case study of what not to do when developing an engaging endgame."

reviewText:
Edit:

This game has great potential, I like doing missions, crafting gear and playing in squads. Yet Ubisoft managed to create one of  the worst PvP experiences I've ever seen.
If you run around in the dark zone looking for gear you might just get ambushed by a group of rogue agents, if they start firing your chances of escaping are minimal. The XP loss is not as big as it was before patch but still significant especially if you are on your own because getting those xp back is going to be harder.
This results in a senseless grind of Dark Zone XP only to be farmed by rogue agents.
Ubisoft, nice try but a big part of your game is a real funkiller.

Since the patch the DZ has become a place where I spent ~ 65% of my time running away from rogue agents (mostly failing), respawning, and trying to extract items (mostly failing).
Now the question I ask is, besides the 3 daily missions what else is there to do in this game? Nothing so far that caught my eye.

- Another big issue is cheating in the DZ, people are able to glitch out of the DZ (into checkpoints) while having rogue status. This is a known issue and Ubisoft doesnt seem to do anything about it.

- Customer support claims they answer within 48 hours, I've written a ticket, updated it after 97 hours, 24 hours still no response. Does customer service even exist? 90 euros for this?
UPDATE on customer support: after waiting for some more days my ticket got deleted without comment. Well thanks ubisoft for not giving a ♥♥♥♥ about customers.

- PC issue: when buying blueprints for gear crafting it is not possible to scroll down to see all of the information that would be available. You have to buy it then you can read everything in a different menu.

- Lootable containers in the base of operations (homebase) should be lootable once per hour (giving crafting material). This does not work properly, I can usually loot 2 or 3 of 4 available containers per hour, the rest stays locked.

- Missions can be played at different difficulties (which is great), the only real problem in challenging missions are shotgunners charging the group and killing them. I hardly ever see a group get wiped by anything else than shotgunners in challenging mode. Not very creative or diverse.

- DZ is not playable in less than excellently equipped squads of 4 people with voice communication. Everything else is just fodder for rogue groups. Either they shoot you right away or they follow you until you want to access a safe room or check point and then just fire away.

- Ubisoft ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ Generator would be an appropriate name for the Dark Zone

reviewText:
I think that the biggest problem of this game is lack of content especially end game content. Cheaters can be handled and are handled. Simply there's not much too do after beating a game. Single player campaign is not that that good either. No decent cut-scenes or story telling. You simply don't care about characters. Which is a shame since they hired good actors, phone recordings really build up lost city atmosphere. I do not have high hopes for the DLC either, judding from what the devs brought up to the table in first free update.

1 mission
4 gear sets (should be there from the beginning)
pseudo-trading - which is in fact very limited loot drop sharing. No economy involved whatsoever.
gear score gimmick

Game summary:
Excellent graphics.
Very good voice acting.
No content (great engine and sandbox but not much to do in there)
AI is dump as #$#!#, so no fun playing missions in co-op over and over again.
Only 4 main missions with challenging difficulty level.
Repetitive side missions.
Plain main mission objective:
- go to beacon A;
- trigger A fired;
- enemies spawning at beacon A
- when enemies killed go to beacon B, and so on

Game difficulty is risen by making from enemies damage sponges.
In Open World gameplay they don't even react when are shot at.

Game has hundreds of small bugs that should not be there upon release in AAA title.

There are so many flaws in this game, I doubt that they will ever fix it.
Game got released, they got our money, most of the development team is probably switching to new projects now.

I do not recommend buying this game now. If you're interested in it wait and see how the situation resolves.
Or just wait for a sale and get it cheap and only if there sill is existing playerbase. The Division is NOT worth the price they asking for it. This game is more like BETA or Early Access and not a finished product.

reviewText:
Sigh.

Let me get one thing straight, right out of the gates: I love this game. My friends and I enjoy utilizing strategy and communication in the missions both hard and challenging, we completely enjoyed the DZ experience just over a month ago before all the hackers and exploiters took over, the tension in extracting loot was real.

However, being a product from Ubisoft, they ♥♥♥♥ed this game. No lube.

My biggest complaint, aside from the complete LACK of any form of anti-cheat/glitch/hack system, is their slow ♥♥♥ development time for fixes and patches. There have been LARGE bugs since release (backpack glitch anyone?) that they STILL have yet to fix. These devs should be ramming patches and hotfixes down our throats to fix all the problems.

Let's run down the pros and cons:

PROS:
-Amazing looking game visually, when your graphics arn't getting screwed by artifacting or glitches.
-Runs quite well, lots of graphic scalability and options.
-Cover system actually isn't TOO terrible, I haven't had too many issues navigating cover.
-Gunplay is solid, responsive, accurate.
-Playing with friends is an absolute must for enjoyment.

CONS:
-The million glitches. Wall glitches, mission glitches, falling through the world glitches, weapon and perk glitches and exploits. The list just goes on and on.
-ZERO anti-cheat system in place, it's like WarZ all over again with the hackers. Soft AF stance on punishing cheaters.
-The current incursion is fun the first time you play, after that it's a repetative chore.
-DZ is basically unplayable due to all the hacks/exploits being used.
-DPS numbers change constantly depending on what weapon you actually have equipped, when viewing other weapons, unreliable system to evaluate other weapons.
-The loot is in SERIOUS need of an overhaul. Yes the 1.2 patch is supposedly addressing this, but this review is of the current state of the game. Loot is basically garbage, anything below challenge mode will give you garbage, crafting was the only way to get decent rolls but they nerfed it into the ground last patch.
-When legit PVP does happen in the DZ, it consists of running around in the middle of the road with an SMG and Survival Link, hoping you kill them before your link wears off, then its combat rolling for days until you get away or die. I don't think I've ever seen anyone really use a skill outside of First Aid.
-Only 4 challenge missions available, gets super snore after a while.

Basically, this game has SO MUCH POTENTIAL, but due to corporate ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t, and Ubisoft being Ubisoft, it is ♥♥♥♥ED. I really want to see this game get better, and not die like lots of other online games have, but the devs need to take a serious step up to the plate and FIX THIS ♥♥♥♥.

On release: 9/10
Currently: 3/10

reviewText:
First of all don't get me wrong, I LOVE THIS GAME, but now to be realistic.

Atm the game is a total mess. PVE can be exploited in 1 milion ways and PVP (Dark Zone) is full with hackers.
The initial ban wave they put out (2 weeks) was good. The game was actually playable. PVP was fun. Now 10.05.2016 the ban wave of 2 weeks is ending and again PVP is full with hackers. In my opinion the punishment they recived is mild at best. Perma ban those ♥♥♥♥ers PLZ so more people can enjoy the game.

A lot of people are talking about the lack of end game content. The game is new, ofcourse it lacks end game atm, but there is a ton of content on the way.
ITS A LOOT BASED GAME, so you should expect grinding !!! They are incresing the quantity and quallity of loot in the next patch. The loot system im sure will be fixed if they take some tips from DIablo3.

To sum up:
I do NOT recemmend this game atm. When the bugs and glitches are fixed and a proper anti-cheat system is in place this will be a beautifull game. It has a lot of potencial to be a great game and i really hope they fix all the problems as fast as possible.
But for now DO NOT buy this game it is a complete mess !!!

reviewText: Made it into end game, game became unplayable.  You'll be lucky if you can get into the mission of your daily, which is perpetually locked.   The only mission worth playing now for best endgame gear is on a week long timer.  The poor devs keep trying to force you into PVP zone to get good gear, but refuse to do anything about hackers. reviewText:
I've put a couple weeks into this game and several things make this game unenjoyable for me.
1: The amount of grinding is crazy. I hit lvl 30 after a few days, got a Gear Score of 180 shortly after. Probably within 24 hours of play. I'm currently at 115 hours and I've moved up a total of 15 Gear score. Its not even enjoyable grinding. You run around in circles picking up gear that you're just going to deconstruct. OVER AND OVER AGAIN.
2: The unfinished state of the game. So many glitches. I get kicked out of the game at least once everytime I play. Glitches ran from game shut downs to the inventory being messed up (Where are the rest of my shoes) to lights not being on in the Base of Operations. It would be one thing if the game had amazing content, perhaps i could ignore the glitches but the fall-off after lvl 30 is like jumping off a cliff. Welcome to running around the dark zone for hours on end with little to no reward. Yaayyyy Monotony.
3: Incursions. The Developer's attempt to spice up the game perfectly incapsulates why this game sucks. You sit in ONE ROOM and battle through 15 grueling waves of people to recieve two pieces of gear that may or may not be something you want. Wow, way to go team. Who wants this ♥♥♥♥? I have 4 pairs of the same gloves. Guess I'll deconstruct them so I can get 2 pieces of fabric. Yayyyy.
4: PVP. So unrewarding. You could literally take down the whole server and recieve nothing for it. Only if you complete your manhunt do you receive a reward. You get less experience for taking down a rogue than you lose from getting killed by one. I love walking into the DZ and getting steam rolled by a manhunt group. Neither side is rewarding 99% of the time. You either die from a rogue or live long enough to die as a manhunt. All for some experience and money to buy gear that frankly, if you're able to survive one, is much worse than what you have.

The realization hit me today that this game is just not fun. Sure you'll waste hours on it thinking you're enjoying yourself but you're falling down a rabbit hole of boredom. Don't waste your time with this dribble of content.

The game could be a lot better if they reduced the amount of bugs, made pvp interesting (there was a group of guys that started a fight club in the DZ that was pretty enjoyable, spice it up boys.) and actually put content into the end game beyond literally running around in circles hoping to see a light at the end of the tunnel,

reviewText:
It's a good looking game which is fun for the most part.

However, it's also a game which has many issues in its current state. Once you've levelled a character to max rank there's really not a lot else to do. Even mopping up collectables or repeating missions for a daily reward becomes unappealing after a short while.

The real problem, however, is the issue with the PVP area, the Dark Zone. There are so many people using hacks and exploits that this whole area of the game is unplayable.

At this point, I'm going to leave the game for a while to see if Massive can patch it to a point where it's playable again.

reviewText: Endgame hits fast. Don't get me wrong it's fun as hell in the beginning. I feel like Ubisoft has given up on the PC version of the game. You can't get any good guns or gear without getting to level 75-90 in the dark zone, and it's a ♥♥♥♥♥ to get to that level because there are hackers everywhere killing you and making you loose XP. Speed hacks wall hacks rate of fire hacks aimbots etc etc. They made the drop rate so high in the game that getting a good item means nothing. They nerfed crafting basically out of existence to buff the drops ridiculously. All NPC's and challenging missions even the Incursion are way too ridiculously easy, so if you're looking for co op play youre looking in the wrong place. All servers are way too small and over crouded as hell you can't even make it halfway to a landmark without it being finished by another group. The only thing left for people to do in this game is go rogue. Which can be fun but this game needs a boatload of work.

reviewText:
This game has the distinct feeling of not even starting until you reach level-cap( so you can basically play it again) ...the result of a horrendously paced, sloppy release.

I still play it becuase I spent around 120 getting it for my self and a friend. ..excited at what the first trailer promised. This is what I have learned:

1)Humans can throw grenades from blocks away.
2) Humans can throw grenades at impossible angles( Hallways, through windows, across building tops)
3) AI has ZERO sense of self preservation
4) ...which is easy when all you have to do is Destiny it up with more health bars
5) Every time you finish an encounter, expect the good guys to JUST showup, right in time to be useless
6) speaking of useless....Reseource Aquisitition missions?. 10 guys standing around but some how YOU are needed to walk 20 ft away and pcik up some suitcases. Why?
7) Hint: Games so simple, just pick up all the suit cases and place them NEAR the box without putting them in. No enemies will spawn to stop you. Brilliant.
8) Take your time using your skills or youll end up activating and IMMIDIEATLY deactivating them.
9) WTF is healing in this game?. Medkits I get but....Green Plus-sign auras that float around? A circle of green  you can just walk in ? That revives?( Most of the time, youl find the insta-revive just about useless when solo-ing)
10) EXPECT GLITCHES.....all the time.....with out fail. enemies that get stuck behind the spawing door. gun not to fire when pulling the trigger...skills that blatantly dont work and (My personal favorite) receiving damage during the loading screen when respawning.
11) you will respawn  into oncoming fire so find cover
12)  and LEARN how to manipulate cover becuase this is literally the worst cover system I have ever seen in a game
13) We have the resources to constantly Hel-evac items but cant clean the items at the mulitple hazard check points that exist in the dark zone?
14)  Post game" is replaying the same missions with enemies with more health. Why? To get higher-level gear. why ? To replay the same 9 or so main missions.
15) Besides pointing in the wrong direction for enemies...your minimap will literally assign a new rally point whenever your close to something. You wanted to go to this encounter....nah....theres a side mission thats nearby and youll automatically fail if you walk past it.
15) why is this game  100% online?

If you like the thought of knowing youre playing a ridiculously unfinished game
date: If you don't like consisitency in game mechanics and look forward to the release of (What looks to be) fan-made youtube videos of "Additional content"...by all means this is the game for you.\n\nRage over."

reviewText:
First off, this was a game I was very excited for. I started this game with 7 other friends, including my brother. Let’s just say as of this past week none of us play anymore. We’ve given up on the game. The game started off a lot of fun, but you soon find yourself bored of running the same 4 challenge missions at end-game. The DZ is completely broken due to various reasons, which some of these reasons fall over into the PvE aspect too. This includes build diversity, which there is none. Glitches and hackers all over the place are completely ruining the game.

This game has a strong emphasis on loot, yet there is next to no loot. Most loot is worthless as the Meta is extremely small. The same can be said about the abilities. The incursions that just came out are completely uncreative and feel as stale as the rest of the end-game. It doesn’t matter because everyone is just using glitches in the incursion anyways. This game has a gorgeous replica of New York City, yet a massive chunk of it is not used in the end-game whatsoever. I recommend not anyone else to buy this game. Do your research before doing so. You’ll see my comments regurgitated here such on YouTube, forums, and other social media outlets. I will not buy another Ubisoft backed game at launch ever again.

reviewText:
Jacko Rating - PC version
6.5/10
The Division is a game that I am not sure where to place - is it an MMO or a FPS shooter with a terrible, generic story?  Yes this is sitting on the fence between the two in my book and it doesn't do a very good job at either genre unfortunately.
To give you a run down of the basic categories the graphics and animations are very nice along with decent audio and voice acting, the story is rubbish and so generic these days, in fact i am not sure how many more post war or zombie games I can take before falling asleep.
The gameplay is decent and the feel of the weapons plus the varity and mods are all good but it does not mesh with the fact that you need to unload full clips into the face of some enemies and even then they still keep going, are these guys super mutants?
The game does deliver fun though - when you finally get connected with your mates and assuming you are all at the same level or very close then you can spend hours runnig through missions and maps together just as you were hoping for when you forked over your hard earned cash.
This unfortunately is also where the games falls down;
- Having to connect to the Ubisoft servers several times just to get into the game
- Getting kicked from server a couple times each gaming session
- Laggy when playing Co Op
- Even more lag when playing Darkzone (PvP)
- And the biggest issue with Division is it ramps enemies up to the highest level player in your group so if I am level 10 but 1 of my mates in Co Op is level 20 then all enemies are set to level 20 and easily 1 shot kill any player less then 4 levels below 20, this is madness it should be running to the lowest level character in the group and ruined a potentially good Co Op game.  4 player Co Op was the biggest draw card for this game.
To sum up the game is better suited to playing solo which would have been fine if the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s didn't market it as a 4 player Co Op masterpiece.

reviewText:
This is a game with great potential, which is being ruined by cheaters and rampant bugs. Ubisoft/Massive did a fantastic job with the play controls and graphics, while the rest of the game was riddled with glitches and generic roles.   The gear stats are far too varied, RNG is on par with Diablo, and the weapons are horribly imbalanced.

Ignoring the cheating and the players taking advantage of glitches (who think they are not cheaters), much of the content were great ideas with poor implimentation.

The Dark Zone's major flaw is that newcomers will forever be steamrolled by players that have been there since the beginning, and solo players will get trounced by groups. That alone is enough incentive to stay away.

The new Incursion is the Division's idea of a Raid"

reviewText: Well join the crowd - the most anticipated release of the year and it was a total bust.  From a content starved initial release to a pure repetitive gear grinding game in less than 2 weeks of ownership.  First preorder I ever remember making and will also be the last.  Story/campaign is short (welcome to Ubisoft games) and lacked any diversity or challenge in the gameplay of those missions, but in fairness the actual story itself was good.  Once you invest a couple nights into working through the storyline and the limited number of missions, you find you are left with doing the missions over and over again, hoping for something decent (gear/weapons) to drop – or the alternative is to venture into the Dark Zone (pvp/multiplayer area), which as it turns out is just a repetitive grindy as the lackluster mission gameplay.  Ultimately the multi-player system is very weak overall, lacking any interesting or significant multiplayer game elements.  Add in getting griefed by hackers shooting through walls and watching hours of gameplay get erased in a few shoft minutes of weaker cellmate prison shower time by one-shot wonders, it's more than just a nuisance, it’s downright stupid.  You can count on that happening once every few days.  The penalty for getting your loot jacked, your DZ chest keys stolen and your DZ funds gobbled up by skill-less wonders isn’t bad enough, they also drop your DZ level experience like a virtue.  A couple hours of work wiped out in a few minutes.. and at a season pass price, it's just about everything you would hope for..  Not that levels are important depending on which month they patch and balance" out the game play
date: which is a bear in it's own right.  You spend a week getting one perfect gear piece
recommended: grinding away on useless drops that you mine for parts
hoursPlayed: only to have it completely invalidated/outdated on the next monthly release with gear level cap increases

reviewText:
The game is in a unplayable state, bad coding, broken ai, bullet sponge, glitches, and unfair game play.
(1) First of all the elite protection bug, items that are suppose to protect you from damage do more damage.
(2) When suppressing a npc, they just go back into full cover, while other npc shoot you, if you try to suppress that npc, the one in cover immediate pop up and shot u.
(3) Enemy takes 4 magazine (gear score 204 assault rifle) to kill with headshots, making most guns feel like a pee shooter.
(4) Glitches and map bugs are all over the place. Seriously who made all the maps?
(5) Missions sometimes are bugged and wont start, require the team to disband, and rejoin the matchmaking.
(6) and now lets go to the bad side of the game. The ai is so generic (cause ubisoft are a bunch of bad coders maybe?) the gun play is boring. Npc has a 100% hit rate with quick aim. Combine with the bulley sponge, making the majority of the game stupid. Its makes you feel like playing arma3 against a zeus admin.
(7) the idea that flaking an enemy is not only useless (cause it takes 4 mag with headshots to kill one) the ai is coded that u will get instantly return fire which might results in kill you
Hornestly did they even test this game before releasing it? The game is not finish, and free dlc is just ubisoft way of saying we having finish the game, here is some extra bits and piece of it.
From now on, i would never buy anything from ubisoft

reviewText:
This game spirals into situation where you just can't make any progress or take too much time to progress, especially with the poor implementation of PVP in this game.

It's still OK if you do not play the dark zone (PVP zone), and you are OK with grinding for gear for a long time in PVE missions/areas.

However this becomes a chicken and egg problem. If you really want to grind" high level items very fast
date: you need to play the dark zone. But if you want to play the dark zone effectively
recommended:
you need high end gear (discounting if you're lucky not to run into high end rogues / cheaters).

Yes you can still play the dark zone even if you are on normal gear as long as you have reasonable skill

Yes you can still grind for high level gear in PVE.

However
hoursPlayed:
chances are high that you will end up feeling frustrated in the end if you encounter what I shall describe below.

=PVE=
Of course
voteText: you can still get high end gear by playing daily missions and Incursions (i.e. Raids). But there are only 3 daily missions a day
helpfulPercent: and chances are you get high end drops that you do not want. You can do things like making multiple characters (to do daily missions multiple times) to farm gear and special credits which you can use to buy high end gear blueprints.\n\nInitially I got sick of what the dark zone has become
votesHelpful: so I thought I can still redeem this game providing me a chance to get gear on PVE/COOP missions like Incursions instead.\n\nIncursions (raids) also give you really high end gear
votesTotal: but if you are the kind who plays with randoms
votesFunny: good luck trying to coordinate winning the mission. I've wasted hours on the team dying in Incursions. That's because Incursions are really long missions and of course you start all over again if the team dies (no checkpoints). The very first incursion was long because instead of trying to make it interesting
commentsCount: it is just waves after waves of bullet sponge enemies
column16: which are easily solved if you have good gear to take them down very fast. (And getting good gear in this game is now a slog.)\n\nIt's better to find a group. Hopefully you get someone with very good gear in your team (or yet
column17: a cheater/exploiter).\n\nThen there's the problem where chances are you get kicked out of a group for having low level gear. Trust me
column18: even if you meet the gear level requirements of the Incursion
column19: it is still really low
column20: and I've seen people get kicked. However
column21: you can still be of reasonable gear and be skilled
column22:
but then you will just slog through and it feels grindy and boring. The very first Incursion mission itself is really boring.

=PVP=
The Dark Zone.

Too many griefers. You come to this point of diminishing returns. If you are unlucky
column23: basically there are rogue agents who camp at extraction points for other players to try to extract high end gear. These players work hard to get high end gear only to get killed by rogue agents who just pick up the loot and extract immediately. Then these rogue agents get better loot and they become more powerful. And the cycle continues.\n\nSure
column24: you can get your team to hunt them down. But only if your team is really high end.\n\nSure
column25: you can try to ask other teams to help you take down the rogue agents
column26:
but doing so is difficult. Main factor is that dying in the dark zone causes you to lose "Dark Zone Credits (Another form of currency to buy dark zone items)" and Dark Zone levels (which is separate from Character Level and also allows you to get dark zone items).

So basically no one wants to waste their time hunting down high geared rogues when they just get killed and respawn so far away from the rest of the team and getting penalties for dying.

Now imagine the above situation with rampant cheating ."

reviewText: Game has a lot of bugs.  Was generally clean on my solo / partner play through with a friend.  Daily missions are a real challenge and I've played a few and continue to fall through the world, have to die and respawn at base.  You can port to your mates sometimes, but not when they are in combat.  This leaves you running back, and into persistent bugs that just continue to drop you out of the world.  There is no community support / feedback / help, and no way to obtain lost" items that can't be claimed by world bugs.  Developers have a lot to do to ensure the world is contiguous and to eliminate major gameplay issues that cease instanced play through terrain bugs and resets."

reviewText: Endgame hits fast. Don't get me wrong it's fun as hell in the beginning. I feel like Ubisoft has given up on the PC version of the game. You can't get any good guns or gear without getting to level 75-90 in the dark zone, and it's a ♥♥♥♥♥ to get to that level because there are hackers everywhere killing you and making you loose XP. Speed hacks wall hacks rate of fire hacks aimbots etc etc. They made the drop rate so high in the game that getting a good item means nothing. They nerfed crafting basically out of existence to buff the drops ridiculously. All NPC's and challenging missions even the Incursion are way too ridiculously easy, so if you're looking for co op play youre looking in the wrong place. All servers are way too small and over crouded as hell you can't even make it halfway to a landmark without it being finished by another group. The only thing left for people to do in this game is go rogue. Which can be fun but this game needs a boatload of work.

reviewText:
First two weeks of playing this game, about 200 hours.
Last two weeks playing this game, 30 hours.
Fortnightly forcast of playing this game, 0 hours.

-Endgame is unfulfilling, hard mode is too easy, challenge mode is too hard (debatable, yes. However if it wasn't so difficult then people wouldn't have spent so much time trying to find exploits in the terrible coding)

-Exploits ruined gear progression. Those who didn't exploit were left behind in the gear race. Those who did spent hours of repetitive keystrokes and got RSI injuries in their hands and forearms and probably deserves some sort of purple heart.

-Hackers and yet further exploits ruined darkzone, coupled with complete lack of useful loot drops and a grind to get the blueprints that was 40% farming mobs and 60% dodging flying, superspeed, players with 1mil dmg at 1mil RPM.


Read article that due to client side files, a complete recode will be required to prevent the hackers.

Might check back in 6 months and see how it's going.

reviewText: Yes after playing 400 + hours this is the final verdict. Tried to give it a chance, waited for updated but it ends up as bland and become non motivating.  I was a early backer and like other got deceived by the marketing eye candy. everyone has nailed it, no Anti cheat system, PVP is more like a troll versus troll and with a couple of unwarrent players who really want a coop fun are caught in between. The udpates on Dark zone to indicate expiry time and all is good as compared to what they threw at us at the begining but still it is not enough to keep a fan. Graphics are good at short distances but long shots are not inspiring. I still some times would check on the game once every 3 weeks to see any solid changes but shame other MMOs much better than this and stayed with them for years.(WOW, FireFall, Planet side 2). Now it has just became a casual adventure for me.\n\nThe only core objectivity for this game is do missions, gather pheonix points and get a bad a$$ M1A SCOM and a VECTOR,45 and go on a trolling rampage in DarkZone. Zero Coop, Zero sense of belonging and zero long term game play.

reviewText: The division is a bottomless pit of time and money wasted.\n200 + hours into the game, and don’t get me wrong, there is a lot of cool things here but in the end you realise; no new content and an excessive amount of incremental increases and resource splits and its only purpose is to make you grind the same content over and over that leads to an bottle neck. A bottle neck that the developers can’t change, with a million updates. The Division is one of the best examples of missed potential, greedy developers and very good pre game marketing. Well done Ubisoft, you’ve tricked me for the last time. Won’t see my money again.\n

reviewText:
I'm just going to post my reddit post because tis the most accurate info I can give anyone looking into this game.

Can a dev please explain to me why you thought it a good idea to give some random player in a group, leader with the power to unanimously kick whoever they want? I mean, a guy doesn't like your name? Kicked. Doesn't like the color shirt you're wearing? Kicked.

So I'm trying to load into a random group on clear sky, ok used to loading screens that's fine. Get into the group everyone is having the bug where you run into the mission area and get transported to the beginning. Ok we all leave group. Another loading screen. Alright I'm going to be patient because I want to try the new content and give this a chance. my gear score is 197, I get it not super high, but it is doable, I know this because I went 20 minutes through the mission yesterday before everyone got spam dced and we gave up. Ok so I join another random group, loading screen, load, I've been kicked already, another loading screen, back in safe zone. Alright well I'm sure that guy was just anal about things, lets give it another go. Loading screen, load, kicked already, back to safe zone. I can't do this game anymore, been patient but even outside of the bugs, which i don't mind giving developers time to fix, this god power you give to random people in groups is just a bad design decision.

This game is unique, exciting and fun, when it works. Right now it feels like archeage with some of these design decisions, rampant exploits (which are not resolved).

I want to love you and spend time and money on you Division. Help me help you.

reviewText:
Lvl 25, I meet my first hacker. My team sees a rogue on our mini-maps and I think, hey it's only one, time for a little fun! We get there only to have him come out of the building, gun down 2 of my 3 man team, leaving me to get his health down half-way before he DESTROYS me via rapid reloading & firing an lmg. Then proceeds to clap slowly while instantly killing a guy 40ft behind him, oh and did I mention these were all head-shots too?

Later on he stacks my team (pub team) into a safe house were no-one listens to anything and they all just rush outside, resulting in a massacre. I make it out by the thread of a hair when I get out and get to an extraction zone, alone, not too far from the safe house. I start the extraction, 10 seconds, nothing. 20, nothing. 50 nothing. Last 20 seconds? ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ shows up, I hear him moving around like a cockroach, decide to jump off the balcony as a last ditch effort to avoid him, get airshot. lose gear but he doesn't take it.. I run back, with the plan to get my gear and go to a checkpoint and wait it out. I grab my gear and run for it. that skull shows up and guess what? It's a manhunt.

I fear for my gear seeing the little meter counter go up and down. Then out of the blue it rapidly descends. My heart is pumping, I sprint to a nearby light generator. Shots ring out through the world as half of my first bar of health is depleted. I take cover and see him down the sidewalk unloading everything. It's like a shower of bullets as I think of what to do.

Then I got it, time to surrender. So that's what I did, used the icon that I've seen only a few use genuinely in my time in the dark-zone. He sprints up and says word for ♥♥♥♥ing word over his mic, Okay
date: we friends now...". Blew my ♥♥♥♥ing mind. At this point I was praising him as a god and started to walk off towards the last stretch of the road towards the checkpoint when he runs in front of me and tells me to *ahem* "kill me". No this isn't a joke
hoursPlayed: this does get worse.\n\nSo we sit there for three minutes as he try's to convince me he won't kill me

reviewText:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

MP = colossal failure.

- inexperienced devs (seriously, it takes a week for them to hotfix gamebreaking bugs)

- rampant cheaters (instead of fixing the RPM hack, they simply changed the values. hack popped up an hour later)

- no anti-cheat present

- uneven loot economy (either you glitch missions to get gear, or play normally and get stomped in the DZ by the former)

- hotfixes take way too long (seriously, check reddit, there are game breaking bugs that have been in the game since beta)

- repetitive end game grind nature (a la Diablo 3, although much slower)

- enemies are the exact same (with the exception of two bosses)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SP = pretty fun!

- lots of collectables (seriously, it takes forever to find them all)

- decent story (kind of predictable a la every Ubisoft game story ever but it works)

- very atmospheric (walking along the streets of NYC gives you chills at night)

- excellent sound design (hearing firefights pop off in the distance makes you alert)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Single Players => Buy it at no more than $25

Multi Players  => Skip!

reviewText:
After playing this game for a good amount of hours, i think its really a Alpha game, it should have never left beta, and for a triple A title, it truly doesnt make up to its hype. this game needs to be fixed before playing again. Before buying this game, wait a couple of months to let the game go through its Phases, to allow it to thaw out and become less glitchy and broken. Lets talk about the Pros | Cons.
Pros:
Very fun game with friends,
Borderlands style loot, and same as destiny.
Dark Zone is Heart pumping.

Cons:
SO MANY GODAMN BUGS
Incursions: Risk VS Reward is not worth it. Challenging is incredibly hard, and only a few have accomplished it Legitly,
Exploits (which i took advantage of cus im a dbag)
End game is a huge grind, taking 15 crafting materials to get that one God roll, and then you find out that it was completely terrible.
Cheaters/No Anti Cheat
still very buggy.
Dark Zone is almost unplayable, due to cheaters, and glitches.
AI Teleport when you shoot at them.
Loot is really not worth going in the darkzone is good, but still you have a chance of being demolished by exploiters and cheaters.

theyre so many differnet things to list, but i got to do some homework.
PS: dont buy this game if you want to have fun by yourself.

reviewText:
I'll give this game credit where credit is due. The graphics are really nice and detail is amazing but that's about it. I don't like the relentless grinding that never really makes me feel like im accomplishing anything or at least getting my character's stats the way I'd like them to be. That would be somewhat forgivable if it weren't for the fact that this game is broken so many different ways. That's just my opinion though but here are some real reasons I have a problem with the game.

-Hackers rampant in the dark zone
-Loot in the dark zone never really being worth the struggle
-Some stats on gear not working properly
-PvP being extremely lopsided and gear based, means you'll likely never get a fair match
-Random server disconnects
-Lack of involvement in the community by massive or ubisoft
-Random crashes
-Incursion(s) being so difficult for little to no real reward
-Season Pass not being worth it
-Lots of random bugs/glitches
-Lack luster clothing/character customization options

The list goes on but most other issues are small enough to be forgivable in my eyes. However after having put in over 100 hours into this game I just find myself getting very bored and fed up with it's problems. I REALLY REALLY want to like this game but this game doesn't want me to like it. Until most if not all of these issues are fixed I can't say I'd recommend this game, at least not at it's current price.

reviewText:
Pros:  Good story, voice acting, and missions are well done.

Cons:  Too many bugs!  Every fix brings something new.  And some things have not been fixed since launch.

-Too many actual hackers in the Dark Zone.
-Game is revolved around loot, and loot does not drop properly, and if it does, it's bad quality
-Some missions do not start for end-game.
-Exploits, and threats to be punished for stuff that is not getting fixed/patched fast enough.

I will keep playing in hopes that it will get better.  Since these guys obviously have no idea how to balance things, and are taking advice from someone who worked on mobile games/micro transaction games.  But as it stands, don't bother wasting your money on it.  I bought both the main game, and the season pass.  So far, they haven't really lived up to what they promised.  Wait till it goes on sale!
